Falcon Pointe 
HOA
Wooden Fence 
Replacement Overview



Contents

• Service Offering Summary
• Fence Improvements
• Operational Process
• Warranty
• Residential Offering



Service Offering Inclusion Summary
✓ Confirm resident notification with fence replacement date range
✓ Old fence teardown
✓ Old fence materials haul off
✓ Remove minor vegetation and minor landscaping fence line obstructions
✓ Reset/level plumb metal posts in concrete
✓ Temporary install privacy screen fabric while concrete sets, approximately 

one to four days, weather permitting (fabric NOT designed for pet 
containment)

✓ Install 100% cedar fence, pre-stained wood with oil base stain
✓ Assembled with exterior coated screws (allows for easy repair/disassembly)
✓ Clean up area, includes pressure washing concrete as needed
✓ 10-year workmanship warranty 
✓ 3-year stain warranty (does NOT cover sprinkler water marks)



Fence Improvements
Category Existing Fence New Fence
Repels Water/Ice Only one side of fence ~40% 100% of fence

Fasteners Ring Shank Nails (Ruins wood for repair) Screws (Easy repair)

Staining Application One side – only street side All 6 sides of each board

Staining Application Top cap board NOT stained Top board stained

Staining Application Resident responsible for inside N/A – Non-issue

Staining Application Over spray protection required (cars, pools, house, 
residential/HOA landscaping, backyard items, etc.)

N/A – Done offsite

Staining Application Weather permitting, causes delays, residential 
coordination/scheduling required

N/A – Done offsite

Staining Price Includes material and labor cost for One side 
application (Excludes Top Cap)

Includes material cost for ALL sides

documents.content:
Paints 
(Volume discount)

Wood Type Sizes: 
2x8,2X6,2x4,1X6X6

Same (Cedar) Same (Cedar)



Operational Process

Notify

•Coordinate scheduling notifications to residents of HOA fence replacement
•Encourage residents to replace their adjacent HOA type fence at the same time; Provide quotes upon request

(Residential fence installation at a later date will likely cost more)

Teardown

•Dismantle old fence
•Haul off old fence material
•Clear fence line of vegetation obstruction

Build

•Reset/level plumb posts in concrete 
•Set up privacy screen (while concrete dries)
• Install wood fence material

Clean Up

•Pick up wood scraps
•Rinse off area and pressure wash as needed



Fence and Stain Warranty

• 10-Year Warranty on the fence workmanship
• 3-Year Warranty on the fence stain, however, excludes areas with 

sprinkler water marks and damage cause intentional defacing
• Contact us at https://romanspwfs.com/ to file a claim

https://romanspwfs.com/


Residential Fence Replacement

• Follows the same process of the HOA fence replacement
• Billed directly to the resident (50% due before 

teardown/installation)
• Will not delay HOA timeline
• Will likely cost more if done at a later date



Thank you!

Page 1 of 2

ASPC - Falcon Point (Goodwin & Company)
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Gino Cebollero,

We are pleased to provide you with a proposal to complete the exterior service repairs at your community located at 19015 Falcon
Pointe Blvd Pflugerville, TX 78660.
 
We appreciate the opportunity to provide this proposal to you and hope to earn your business. Don't hesitate to get in touch with me
with any questions.
 
Henry Cuadros
Branch Manager of Texas
(262) 629-7151

Scope of Work: Fence Audit Report
 

Crew member(s) will have on a high visibility logoed shirts to easily identified1.
Site audit report with pictures, location & a scope provided to client/management for repairs2.
Issues identified will be documented in the order they should be addressed/repaired3.

Note
This includes inspecting all areas identified in map provided by client/manager1.
Day(s) to complete inspection & report 3weeks -15 days weather permitting2.

Total: $3200.00



Page 2 of 2

ASPC - Falcon Point (Goodwin & Company)
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Assumptions, Clarifications and Exclusions:
This proposal may be withdrawn by Aspen Group if not accepted within 30 days.1.
Pricing assumes unfettered access to the property during the project.2.
If Aspen Group encounters unforeseen conditions that differ from those anticipated or ordinarily found to3.
exist in the construction activities being provided, Aspen Group retains the right to make an equitable
adjustment to the pricing.
Client will provide electrical power and water at no charge.4.
Client will provide a location for dumpster on site for trash and material disposal.5.
Mold/Asbestos/Lead Paint: Any detection or remediation of mold, asbestos, and lead paint is specifically6.
excluded from this proposal. Any costs associated with the detection and/or removal of mold, mold spores,
asbestos, and lead paint is the responsibility of others.

Scope of Work
We would like to thank you for giving us the opportunity to earn your business. We've
included a detailed estimate of your project along with as many details as possilble

If you have any questions about our bid, material, service, pricing or any other question,
please don't hesitate to call. We have many price points that fits most budgets. 

We've been building all types of fences since 2006. We build residential & commercial, wood
privacy of just about any style, ornamental iron, chainlink, custom gates, gate operators
installation, decks & pergolas. We always use screws as fasteners not nails. We use premium
quality wood on all wood projects, superior quality ornamental iron (wrought iron) & buy from
the national suppliers for consistency and lower prices. Not the big box stores, actual fence
suppliers.

We build over 25 miles of fence a year and our combined years of fence experience is near
150 years. We are the Premier fence company of Central Texas if you want it built right and to

documents.content:
Goodwin & Company (Exterior)
ASPC - Falcon Point
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Gino Cebollero,

We are pleased to provide you with a proposal to complete the exterior service repairs at your community located at 19015 Falcon
Pointe Blvd  Pflugerville, TX 78660.
 
Our team provides top-tier solutions, from painting and power washing to full exterior transformations, all crafted to enhance the beauty and
durability of your property. With our expertise and dedication to excellence, we are confident that our services will not only meet but surpass your
expectations. We look forward to bringing your vision to life.
Please feel free to contact us with any questions or if you need further information

 
Henry Cuadros
Branch Manager of Texas
(262) 629-7151

Scope of Work:

This proposal covers the cost of labor and materials needed for the requested fence repairs located at 19015 Falcon Pointe
Blvd. covering fence lines 4, 5, 8, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 47, 51, 55, and 56 that where identified to be the most needed repairs

•

While on-site, workers will be wearing fluorescent green, high-viz shirts as well as any other PPE necessary to safely complete
the repairs.

•

Work area will be secured with caution tape and cones.•
Before work begins sufficient notice must be sent out to residents•
Work will begin on fenceline 4 and work up•
 Approximately (92) 1”x6’ cedar pickets; (8) 2”x6” cedar top plates; (18) 2”x4” cedar bottom plates will be replaced and (7) 2”x4”
cedar bottom rails will be re-secured.

•

 All connectors will be corrosive-resistant, galvanized screws/nails.•
All wood will be cedar to match the existing and receive a stain to match the color•
Stain will be certified Sherwin William and will receive a standard two-coat process 3 if necessary•
 Work areas will be thoroughly cleaned.•
 All trash and debris will be disposed of legally.•

Total: $14,363.10



Goodwin & Company (Exterior)
ASPC - Falcon Point
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd

April 2024 ManApril 2024 Man ​agement Reportagement Report
Falcon Pointe Community AssociationFalcon Pointe Community Association

April 26, 2024
 
Falcon Pointe Community, Inc.
Board of Directors
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd.        
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Board Members,
 
Below you will find a summary of operations, administrative,
fiscal/accounting, maintenance, community standards, lifestyle,
and other operational items for March 2024. Please let me know
if you have any questions.

General Operations/AdministrativeGeneral Operations/Administrative

Updated PAL (priority action list) from the March 19 th meeting on Trello.
Working with the office staff at Longoria Masonry to determine which residents' rock walls are
being worked on to get notices out.
Installed the 30.05 gun sign at the amenity center.
Reached out to Vendors for proposals on wood fencing, wood staining, elkay drinking fountain
repair, electrical, and Shade Structures.
Working with the Landscape Committee to provide them with parkland agreement information
and erosion area information.
Tested sending the Quarterly Newsletter through Constant Contact vs. TownSQ and Goodwin
Notices.
Made a workable spreadsheet for resident wood fence repair requests. This way, we can
determine which sections of fencing we need to start repairs on first. Currently seeking vendors
for this project.
Tarryn submitted her resignation on April 10th, with her last day being April 22nd. She accepted a
management role at the Stone Hill Apartments across the street, and we wish her the best of
luck!
Justin Hale has accepted the ACAM/Lifestyle Coordinator position for Falcon Pointe and will

begin his 90-day onboarding and orientation on Monday, April 29th.

View the April Management SummaryView the April Management Summary
HereHere

Fiscal/AccountingFiscal/Accounting

March 31, 2024- Operating cash $390k, Reserve cash $886k.
Net income/gain in March 2024 was $168,946.94.

Proper prep. Masking to protect property. Powerwash and acid wash the existing texture. Install two coats of Suncoat clear 
sealer with Shark Grip. Clean up when work is complete. Clear sealer - $8,932.00
Note: There will be a one-year warranty on the clear sealer guaranteeing our clear sealer will bond to the existing texture. If 
the existing texture disbonds from the previous company, this does not fall under one-year warranty service for the sealer. It 
is our recommendation to clear seal the current texture which will add an additional wear layer and reflect UV rays. UV rays 
bake the texture causing it to become brittle and disbond. Clear sealers also are more resistant to chemicals, staining, and 
easier to clean. To help protect your initial investment - Recommendations prior to clear:
Crack treatment - $200.00           Misc. Repairs:  Spot texture, spot color, extra masking  - $600.00

DISCLAIMERS
Color Matching ​- Suncoat of Texas neither expresses nor implies that the color being installed will match exactly to samples, existing coatings, other companies 

color charts/samples. Due to sun exposure and other natural outside elements colors vary over time and can NOT be matched. Actual colors may vary due to 
job conditions, mix designs, texture/application techniques and temperatures. 
Cleaning-​ Suncoat of Texas assumes no responsibility for the cleaning of any personal property after the installation of our Suncoat system. The installation 

process may require power washing, grinding and removal.

Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association, Inc. 

COVID-19 Temporary Pool Protocols and Rules 

 

COVID-19 Warning: The danger of exposure to the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 still exists. The 

Association cannot ensure that any surface is germ-free. By entering the Falcon Pointe Community pool, 

courts and park areas, you take responsibility for your own protection, including for disinfecting your hands 

and any surface you touch.   

Gate Guards reserve the right to close the pool at any time. Usage is by reservation only. 

Current Capacity Limits: 50% (68 people) 

Lap Pool Hours 5am-7am, and 7:30pm-10:00pm 

Recreational Pool Hours 11am to 7pm 

✓ Face masks are required over age of 6 during check-in, check-out and while using bathrooms. 

✓ The pool gate will remain locked and the Gate Monitor will provide access. Residents must swipe an 

active pool badge. Once admitted electronically, residents are required to check in/out with the Gate 

Monitor who will log the arrival and departure date/times, verify reservation, number in group, and obtain 

a signed waiver from each adult. The hard copy, signed waiver, will be filed under your address. 

✓ Residents must wait outside the gate until other residents leave from their block of time. If the pool is 

experiencing high demand, residents may be limited to three or less visits per week. 

✓ All households will be required to have a signed liability waiver on file (listing all accompanying minor 

children, if any). NO GUESTS ALLOWED, AT THIS TIME. To save time at check-in and reduce contact risk, 

please download the waiver from the townsq.io website to print and sign at home and bring with you. 

You’ll need your HOA account number to register for townsq.io. This can be found on your HOA statement. 

You can contact Customer Service for assistance, if you do not know your account number, contact 

info@goodwintx.com, or 512.502.7515 (please leave a detailed message including your address and

Once admitted electronically, residents are required to check in/out with the Gate Monitor who will log the arrival and departure date/times, verify reservation, number in group, and obtain a signed waiver from each adult. The hard copy, signed waiver, will be filed under your address.
✓ Residents must wait outside the gate until other residents leave from their block of time. If the pool is experiencing high demand, residents may be limited to three or less visits per week.

documents.content:
BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING
FALCON POINTE COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
Wednesday, April 11, 2018 6:15 PM

Falcon Pointe Clubhouse
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX  78660

MINUTES


Call to Order
President, Debora Harris, called the meeting to order at 6:15 pm. 

Roll Call/Verify Quorum
Quorum was met with all Board Members present, Debora Harris, Matt Burkhard, Rick Minton, Mark Gladney, and Sandra Tognetti. 

New Manager Introduction and Role 
Board President, introduced the new Community Manager, Monique Williams. Matt Gibson from Goodwin Management was also present, and was asked about the status of hiring a part time assistant. Matt G. advised that they have an interested party that is already an employee of Goodwin, currently providing customer service and back end support. He further explained that, just as Natalie did previously, Monique will be the point of contact for the Falcon Pointe Condominiums (Paired Villas). This is not heavy demand, normally only takes 30 minutes every other week, Falcon Pointe is not billed for this time, the condos are. Questions regarding the shared use agreement arose, and it was clarified that the agreement was put in place by the Developer Board during declarant control (2016). Paired Villa owners can utilize the amenities at Falcon Pointe for an annual fee of $288.00. 

Executive Session 
Residents were excused and board meeting adjourned into executive session.  
a. Owner hearing, leash violation dispute. In summary, owner agreed to pay the fine and keep dog(s) on a leash while on Falcon Pointe property and seeks to have no further contact with the complainant (reporting homeowner). Executive session adjourned at 6:42 p.m.

President called Board Meeting to order at 6:43 pm

Approval of Board Meeting Minutes (February 19, 2018)
President called for a motion to approve the minutes, VP, Rick, motioned to approve the minutes as drafted, Treasurer, Sandra, seconded. Motion passed unanimously. 

New Business
a.

documents.content:
Meeting of the Voting Representatives 4-13-13

1)  Neighborhood Watch meeting May 3 @ 6 pm at Resident’s  Center  (hosted by Katie Visciani)
2)  Developer’s Report:  
0. Construction is in process on the south entrance to Falcon Pointe (Lone Star Blvd.)This road connect the south section of the subdivision to Pflugerville Parkway (near Pflugerville Parkway and SH 130
0. A new park will be built at south entrance.  The park to include a small amphitheater and a fishing pier.
0. There will be another route from the 685 crossover (over SH 130).The road will connect to Kelly Lane.  
0. The Senior Apartment Community to be located near Hendrickson HS is still in the going through the approval process.  
0. The question was asked if the Stepping Stone School was still planning on coming to Falcon Pointe, but this is still uncertain.

3) Voting Representatives Election to be held on May 21. Please let Diane know (if you haven’t already) if you are interested in being on the ballot again in 2013. The Annual Meeting will be June 25.
4) Yard of the month started up again in April.  Please submit photos to Sara Bogan to post on the Voting Reps FB page.
5) Discussion of Senate Bill 198 which would allow homeowners to install drought resistant landscaping or water conserving turf, but it would still allow HOAs to require that homeowners submit their plans for approval. The bill passed the committee unanimously, and now it heads to the Senate.  This change would be effective Sept. 1, 2013. Ms. Bottema reminded the Board of upcoming meeting dates and the Voting Representatives Election to be held on May 21, 2013. 
6) Discussion of Pets without leashes and barking dogs.  Both are violations of the Deed Restrictions and Pflugerville City Ordinance.
7) Sherry Cowan asked about the possibility of starting a Garden Club in Falcon Pointe, and having the 4th of July Parade.  We discussed using “Survey Monkey” to see if there was an interest in these events.

RESIDENTS’ CLUB INSTRUCTOR AGREEMENT 
 

Falcon Pointe Resident Information    Date: ____________________  
 

Falcon Pointe Resident Name: ______________________________________ 
 

Falcon Pointe  
Property Address: ____________________________________ 
 

Please check the appropriate box:        Property owner         Tenant    
 

Home Phone: ______________________ Work Phone: _______________________________ 
 

Cell Phone: ________________________ Email Address: ______________________________ 
 

Class Information – (attached flyer and biography required) 
 

Name of Class:  ____________________________________________________________ 
 

Class Day(s): ______________________________________________________________ 
 

Start and Finish Time of Class: _____________________ to ______________________ 
 

Fee for Class: _______________________________________________________________________________ 
 

Class Policy/Rules 
 

SECTION 1:  Residents’ Club Class Eligibility:  Classes must be conducted by a resident. Classes will only be considered 
for “Residents in good standing” with the Association.  “Residents in good standing” are defined as Residents that:  
 

a.) Are current with their Association assessments or other fees 
b.) Do not currently have unpaid fines assessed against their account 
c.) Do not currently have any property violations 
d.) Do not have any pending litigation with the Association 

 
 

SECTION 2:  Residents’ Club Class Availability - Days/Hours:  The Residents’ Club is available for reservations from 
6:00AM until 9:00PM Monday - Thursday. In general, a class is not to exceed two (2) hours including setup and 
cleanup, before and after the Class.  Requests for Classes extending beyond the time limit will be reviewed for approval 
on a case-by-case basis.

documents.content:
January 8, 2015 

 
 

Natalie Boykin 

Association Manager 

Falcon Pointe Community Association, Inc. 

19015 Falcon Pointe Boulevard 
Pflugerville, TX 78660 
 

RE: Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association Landscape Maintenance 

 
 

Dear Natalie, 
 

ValleyCrest is pleased to submit a professional landscape maintenance proposal for 

Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association. We are very excited by the opportunity to 

continue our partnership with you on the continual improvement of this great community. 

We commit to provide an exceptional level of service and quality.  

 

The enclosed proposal was developed based on your feedback, coupled with our 

evaluation of the property conditions, and will demonstrate how our experienced, skilled 

team will achieve the goal of keeping Falcon Pointe looking its best. Throughout our 

service partnership, you will see a continued focus on the level of customer service, site 

quality and communication. In particular the following are areas that you indicated as high 

priority will receive special attention: 

 

 

 Priority Item #1 Irrigation Management – As your partner, it is our goal to work with 

you towards continual improvement of the irrigation system to ensure efficient and 

effective watering methods. Our team of dedicated irrigation professionals developed a 

watering plan to adequately irrigate all of the community under the guidelines of the 

Stage III water restrictions. While the City of Pflugerville does not grant variances under 

Stage III water restrictions, our watering plan was adapted by the City of Pflugerville 

and a Large Property Variance was granted.  

 

12909 Dessau Road 

Austin, Texas 78754 

tel:  512.989.5724 

fax: 512.990.7997 

 

www.valleycrest.com 

 



 Priority Item #2 Turf Quality Improvement – Turf quality is an important part of 

creating a pristine look at Falcon Pointe. This is becoming increasingly challenging in

documents.content:
Code of Conduct, and the Falcon Pointe Community Association Social Media 

Policy.  Service on the committee will be for a term of two (2) years, and shall be at the discretion of the 

Board. A member of the Falcon Pointe Home Owner’s Association Board of Directors (Board) may serve 

in capacity as liaison to the Committee, but may not contribute as a reviewer or voting member. 

Responsibilities of the Committee & Members  
as defined in Declaration to include (but not limited to): 

1. Act in a fiduciary manner in serving the modification needs of the Falcon Pointe Community 

Association. 

2. Regularly attend meetings of the Committee as set by the chairperson. 

3. Maintain a working knowledge of the Guidelines as they pertain to modifications. 

4. Review modification requests and respond to submissions within sixty (60) days, not including 

legal holidays, of the Committee’s receipt of a complete Modification Request. 

5. Ensure actions and responses to Modification Requests are based in accordance with the 

Guidelines. 

6. As needed, review and recommend to the Board suggested changes to the Architectural 

Guidelines. All recommended changes will be subject to legal counsel review and Board approval.  

 

I hereby acknowledge that I have read, understand, and agree to the terms of this document relating 

to my responsibilities as a member of the Falcon Pointe HOA Modification Committee. 

 

Printed Name  Signature  Date 

 

 

Falcon Pointe Community Association Modification Committee Application and Charter Ratified: 22Mar2022

documents.content:
should remain at four inches above the tops of 

adjacent plant material when fully extended. 
2.1.70. Spray pattern of each sprinkler head to be maintained for proper water distribution and to 

minimize overflow of water onto sidewalks, driveways, roads and facilities. 
2.1.71. The contractor must maintain seals to prevent weeping of water from the system while 

operating. 
2.1.72. If possible, The sprinkler system shall be checked immediately after each mowing for any 

damages, which shall be repaired by the contractor at the contractor’s expense. Repairs should 
be made with parts that are the same or equal to original parts. 

2.1.73. The system shall be fully evaluated at the time the contractor begins work on the property. This 
evaluation, along with cost estimates to bring the system to acceptable working conditions, 
shall be given in writing to Falcon Pointe HOA. The cost of this initial evaluation shall be the 
responsibility of the contractor. Any necessary repairs shall be at the expense of the Falcon 
Pointe HOA if approved. 

 
 
 
2.1.74. COMMUNITY BOUNDARIES STANDARD 



Page 7 of 13   
 

Contained herein is proprietary or confidential information that Falcon Pointe HOA requests are not released to persons outside the 
organization, except for review and evaluation purposes. 

2.1.75. Where applicable, the contractor shall include details on trimming along community 
boundaries such as fences, walls, etc. This shall be accomplished based upon local code 
enforcement guidelines and/or ordinances and uniformity of appearance. 

2.1.76. Where applicable, the contractor should include the cost of trimming any fenced or wall areas 
in the basic services annual rate. Frequency shall be determined by the Community Association 
Manager and shall, at a minimum, meet local code enforcement guidelines and/or ordinances. 

2.1.77. Contractor shall reference community maps depicting landscaping zones/areas of 
responsibility.

by the Avalon Reviewer. Notwithstanding the above, any wood fence may be installed

Fences shall be constructed of 

i ! r (b) black coated wrought iron or decorative metal construction approved 

by the Avalon Reviewer. Notwithstanding the above, any wood fence may be installed 

with Rightwood Sahara Gold or comparable product, approved by the Avalon Reviewer, 
upon initial fence construction by a Homebuilder. The Ferce must be located 10 feet 
from the front of the residence and no farther from the front of the residence than the 
midpoint of the residence. In the event of any dispute or disagreement as to the location 
of a fence on a Lot, the decision of the Avalon Reviewer, in its sole and absolute 

discretion, will be final.

* Fences facing an existing or proposed street or other right-of-way must have the slats 
facing the street or public right-of-way and be capped. All other fencing must be "good 
neighbor fending™. 

* Fences along the side yard of corner lots shall not be placed closer to the public right-of- 

way than eight feet (8') feet from such right-of-way or eighteen feet (18') from the back of 
curb. 

Once any Lot that contains a model home is conveyed from either the Declarant or a builder 
to an Owner, the fencing on such Lot must be modified to meet the fencing restrictions of this 
section.

extracted.answer: Pool hours are 6:00AM-10:00PM. The pool is for private use by Avalon residents and their guests only. Key rules include: residents must be 16 to enter alone, 18 to bring guests, maximum 6 guests per household, no glass, no pets, appropriate swim attire required, no diving/jumping, and no private parties without prior approval.
extracted.quote:
Pool Hours:  6:00AM-10:00PM
POOL IS FOR PRIVATE USE BY AVALON RESIDENTS AND THEIR GUESTS ONLY
extracted.summary: Detailed pool rules for the Avalon community, covering access, behavior, and safety guidelines

documents.content:
AVALON POOL RULES
Pool Hours:  6:00AM-10:00PM
POOL IS FOR PRIVATE USE BY AVALON RESIDENTS AND THEIR GUESTS ONLY
SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK-NO LIFEGUARD ON DUTY
IN CASE OF EMERGENCY DIAL 911
RESIDENTS MUST BE 16 YEARS OF AGE TO ENTER BY THEMSELVES WITHOUT BEING ACCOMPANIED BY AN ADULT.
RESIDENTS MUST BE 18 YEARS OF AGE TO BRING IN A GUEST(S).
MAXIMUM OF 6 GUESTS PER HOUSEHOLD
DO NOT OPEN THE GATE OR ALLOW ADMITTANCE TO THOSE NOT IN YOUR GROUP.
ALL CHILDREN UNDER 4 YEARS OF AGE MUST WEAR A SWIM DIAPER AND PLASTIC PANTS AT ALL TIMES EVEN IF POTTY TRAINED.
DO NOT CHANGE DIAPERS WITHIN 6 FEET OF THE POOL.  
NO GLASS ALLOWED IN THE POOL AREA.
ALL FOOD AND BEVERAGES MUST BE KEPT A LEAST 6 FEET FROM THE POOL EDGE.
NO PETS ALLOWED IN THE POOL AREA
NO LOUD MUSIC, SPEAKERS, PROFANITY, RUNNING OR HORSEPLAY PERMITTED
NO PELLET, AIRSOFT OR GUNS OF ANY TYPE PERMITTED 
APPROPRIATE SWIM ATTIRE IS REQUIRED AT ALL TIMES.
NO DIVING, JUMPING OR RIDING ON SHOULDERS PERMITTED.
NO BALLS OTHER THAN BEACH OR NERF ARE ALLOWED IN POOL AREA.
BICYCLES, SCOOTERS, TRICYCLES OR RIDING TOYS ARE NOT PERMITTED BEYOND THE POOL GATE.
NO PRIVATE PARTIES OR SWIM CLASSES WITHOUT PRIOR APPROVAL 
CONDUCT DEEMED RUDE, DISRUPTIVE, DISORDERLY OR DRUNK WILL RESULT IN EVICTION FROM POOL AREA AND MAY RESULT IN LOSS OF FUTURE POOL USE.
IN EVENT OF POOL MALFUNCTION OR OTHER NON-EMERGENCY ISSUES, PLEASE CONTACT PS PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AT 512 251-6122

BICYCLES, SCOOTERS, TRICYCLES OR RIDING TOYS ARE NOT PERMITTED BEYOND THE POOL GATE.

I 

(f) No oil drilling, oil development operation, oil refining, quarrying or 
mining operations of any kind shall be permitted on the surface of the Property. No oil 
wells, tanks, tunnels, mineral excavations or shafts shall be permitted upon or in any part 
of the Property. No derrick or other structure designed for use in quarrying or boring for 
oil, natural gas or other minerals shall be erected, maintained or permitted on the 
Property. 

(g) No animals, livestock, fowl or poultry of any kind shall be raised, bred or 
kept on the Property, except that dogs, cats or other household pets may be kept for the 
purpose of providing companionship for the private family. Animals are notto be raised, 
bred or kept for commercial purposes or for food. It is the purpose of these provisions to 
restrict the use of the Property so that no person shall quarter on any part of the Property 
cows, horses, bees, pigeons, hogs, sheep, goats, guinea fowls, ducks, chickens, turkeys, 
skunks or any other animals that may interfere with the quietude, health or safety of the 
community. No more than three pets will be permitted on each Lot. Pets must be 
restrained or confined to the rear of the Owner's Lot inside a fenced area or Vlithin the 
house. It is the pet owner's responsibility to keep the Lot clean and free of pet debris. All 
animals must be properly tagged for identification and vaccinated against rabies. 

(h) No Lot or other area on the Property shall be used as a dumping ground 
for rubbish or a site for the accumulation of unsightly materials of any kind, including, 
but not limited to, broken or rusty equipment, disassembled or inoperative cars and 
discarded appliances and furniture. Trash, garbage or other waste shall not be kept 
except in sanitary containers. All equipment for the storage or other disposal of such 
material shall be kept in clean and sanitary condition. All containers and other facilities

2.06 Animals - Household Pets. No animals, including pigs, hogs, swine, poultry, 
fowl, wild animals, horses, cattle, sheep, goats, or any other type of animal not considered to be 
a domestic household pet within the ordinary meaning and interpretation of such words may 
be kept, maintained, or cared for on or within the Development Area. No Owner may keep on 
such Owner's Lot more than four (4) cats and dogs, in the aggregate. No animal will be allowed 
to make an unreasonable amount of noise, or to become a nuisance, and no domestic pets will 
be allowed within the Development Area other than on the Lot of its Owner unless confined to 
a leash. No animal may be stabled, maintained, kept, cared for, or boarded for hire or 
remuneration within the Development Area, and no kennels or breeding operation will be 
allowed. No animal will be allowed to run at large, and all animals will be kept within enclosed 
areas which must be clean, sanitary, and reasonably free of refuse, insects, and waste at all 
times. All pet waste will be removed and appropriately disposed of by the Owner of the pet. 
All pets must be registered, licensed and inoculated as required by law. 

2.07 Rubbish and Debris. No rubbish or debris of any kind may be placed or 
permitted to accumulate on or within the Development Area, and no odors will be permitted to 
arise therefrom so as to render all or any portion of the Development Area unsanitary, 
unsightly, offensive, or detrimental to any other property or to its occupants. Refuse, garbage, 
and trash must be kept at all times in covered containers, and such containers must be kept 
within enclosed structures or appropriately screened from view. Each Owner will contract with 
an independent disposal service to collect all garbage or other wastes, if such service is not 
provided by a governmental entity or the Association. 

2.08 Maintenance. The Owners of each Lot shall jointly and severally have the duty

• 

• 

The following restrictions apply to signs advertising a political candidate or ballot item for an 
election, as described in Chapter 202: 

a. The signs may be displayed only during the period beginning 90 days before the date of the election to 
which the sign relates and ending 10 days after that election date. 

b. Only one sign for each candidate or ballot item may be displayed at each residence, and no sign may 
be larger than four feet by six feet. 

c. Each sign must be ground-mounted, and no sign may (i) contains roofing material, siding, paving 
materials, flora, one or more balloons or lights, or any other similar building, landscaping, or nonstandard 
decorative component, (ii) be attached in any way to plant material, a traffic control device, a light, a 
trailer, a vehicle, or any other existing structure or object, (iii) include the painting of architectural 
surfaces, (iv) threaten the public health or safety, (v) violate a law, (vi) contain language, graphics, or 
any display that would be offensive to the ordinary person, or (vii) be accompanied by music or other 
sounds, by streamers, or otherwise be distracting to motorists. 

d. The Association may remove a sign displayed in violation of these standards. 

12. Lights: states, " ... No holiday or occasion lighting or decorations shall be installed earlier than 
thirty (30) days prior to occasion and must be removed no later than twenty (20) days after the event. 

13. Disposal of Trash: states, "All rubbish, trash, garbage or other waste shall be kept in sanitary 
containers and out of sight of the Common Area and any street or adjacent Lot, except on days designated 
. .. for pick-up of such garbage." 

14. Animals and Livestock: states, "No more than three (3) pets shall be kept on a Lot. All pets must be 
properly tagged for identification ... No pet may be chained or leashed outside an enclosure unless being 
walked on a leash.

documents.content:
ChimneyHill Residents
IMPORTANT REMINDER REGARDING PETS
In accordance with the ChimneyHill Community Deed Restrictions, all pets must be controlled so as not to imperil the safety of others or create a nuisance, a disturbance or damage to any property with the community.  All pets must be on a leash and always controlled by the owner (NOT STAKED) while outdoors.
It is the responsibility of the pet owner to pick up and properly dispose of ALL animal waste while outdoors with their pets.  Individual Homeowner lots are not approved pet walking areas and should be avoided for animal defecation.   Approved pet walking areas are the Hiking Trail and the area north of Wimbledon Drive.   
Please be courteous to your neighbors and keep our community safe and clean by being RESPONSIBLE for your pets.

"No more than three (3) pets shall be kept on a Lot. All pets must be 
properly tagged for identification ... No pet may be chained or leashed outside an enclosure unless being 
walked on a leash. Whenever a pet is removed from its enclosure, it must be in the possession of its owner 
or the owner's agent and must be restrained by a proper leash .... All pets must be properly penned in an 
approved enclosure. The enclosure design, location upon the lot, dimensions, and other specifications 
(i.e. height, color, materials) must be submitted to the Architectural Control Committee for approval (see

Avalon Master Community, Inc. (the “Association”) was created to administer the terms 

and provisions of the governing documents and enforce the rules, regulations, and restrictive 

covenants for the community and real property subject to the Master Covenant. Unless the 
Master Covenant or applicable law expressly provides otherwise, the Association acts through a 
majority of its Board of Directors (the “Board”). The Association is empowered to enforce the 

covenants, conditions and restrictions of the Master Covenant, Certificate of Formation or 

Articles of Incorporation, Bylaws, Development Area Declarations, and any rules and 

regulations promulgated by the Association pursuant to the Master Covenant and Bylaws, as 

adopted and amended from time to time (collectively, the “Documents”).

and the Association have the authority to make rules, the Board hereby adopts the following

e No plant with thorns, spines, or sharp edges can be used within 6’ of the public sidewalks 

Residents are encouraged to consider converting the sidewalk strip areas (between sidewalk and 

curb) from turf grasses to xeriscaped areas as these areas are difficult to water. This area may be 

composed of a combination of river rock, crushed granite, and include native plantings. 

Submittal Requirements: 

e Completed Architectural Committee Application 

e Completed Architectural Review Process and Procedures 

o Review Fee and Applicable Deposit 

e Summary of the project 

e Plant list with sizes and quantity at installation and maturity 

e Location of proposed beds and defining border and material 

e Drawing on your site plan or comparable plan which shows easements and setbacks, 

Location of existing trees, driveway and sidewalk 

e Estimated completion date

documents.content:
e Side Lot line: 5 feet ' 

The following setbacks shall apply to each corner Lot: 

e Front Lot line: 25 feet 

e Rear Lot line: 20 feet 

e Side Lot line - Side of Lot adjacent to, or facing the street: 15 feet 

e Side Lot line: - Side of Lot adjacent to, or facing any other Lot: 5 feet 

e Corner lots that share a common side line with a landscape easement on the street side of 

the lot are only required to have a 5 foot setback from the landscape easement. 

Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in these Design Guidelines, a covered porch shall 

be permitted to extend to a point no closer than ten feet (10") from the rear boundary line of a Lot. 

The Avalon Reviewer must approve the encroachment of any flatwork, i.e. driveway, porch, etc. 

over the side building setbacks. 

The Avalon Reviewer reserves the right to stipulate additional building or improvement setbacks 

attributable to any Lot. The Avalon Reviewer further reserves the right to grant variances to the 

setbacks set forth herein under special circumstances, as determined in the sole and absolute 

discretion of the Avalon Reviewer. 

Owners will generally be permitted to erect one (1) accessory structure on their Lot providing the

Design Guidelines and not otherwise defined in this document shall have the same meaning as 
set forth in the Development Area Declaration. 

Amendments 

The Avalon Reviewer may amend these Design Guidelines. All amendments shall become 
effective upon recordation in the Official Public Records of Travis County, Texas. Amendments 
shall not apply retroactively so as to require modification or removal of work already approved 
and completed or approved and in progress. It is the responsibility of each Owner to ensure that 
they have the most current edition of the Design Guidelines and every amendment thereto. 

Architectural Review Process 

Submittals 

Requests for approval of proposed construction, landscaping, or exterior modifications must by 
made by submitting an application in the form attached hereto as Attachment 1. 

Timing 

The Avalon Reviewer will attempt to review all applications and submittals within thirty (30) 
days. Please allow at least thirty (30) days prior to installation or construction for the Avalon 
Reviewer to review the related applications. 

Responsibility for Compliance 

An applicant is responsible for ensuring that all of the applicant's representatives, including the 
applicant's architect, engineer, contractors, subcontractors, and their agents and employees, are 
aware of these Design Guidelines and all requirements imposed by the Avalon Reviewer as a 
condition of approval. 

Inspection 

Upon completion of all approved work, the Owner must notify the Avalon Reviewer. The 
Avalon Reviewer may inspect the work at any time to verify conformance with the approved 
submittals.

Runs with the Land – Refers to a covenant (restrictive or otherwise) that is permanently attached or applicable to 
a particular property. This means that these restrictive covenants transfer with the title to subsequent landowners. 

FORMAT FOR ARCHITECTURAL REVIEW BOARD APPROVAL SUBMISSIONS 

Incomplete applications will not be submitted for Review. 
Review Procedures. All applications should be submitted to the Architectural Review Board, whether it is 
permanent or temporary. The application will be reviewed for completeness. If the application is complete the 
review process may begin. If not, the application will be returned to the homeowner for additional information. 
The Architectural Review Board has thirty (30) days to review an application. The decision of the ARB will be sent 
in writing to the applicant’s address and/or email. 



ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: 
 I acknowledge receipt of the Architectural Design Guidelines and have read and agree to abide with them in 

regards to the modification/addition as proposed 
 I acknowledge that any adverse effects to drainage are my responsibility. The Architectural Committee is 

not responsible for reviewing drainage issues. Large scope projects are susceptible to drainage blocks, and/or 
diversion, which can impact my property and possibly those of adjacent property owners. I also acknowledge these 
precautions and agree not to allow my project to create storm water exit changes, which could result in negative 
conditions. Any negative impact will be my responsibility to correct. 

 I acknowledge if my projects inadvertently causes drainage concerns, I will correct those problems at my 
own cost. 

 I acknowledge if any utility or irrigation lines are damaged due to the improvement I/we make, all the 
repair cost will be my/our responsibility. 

I understand that a deposit and review fee may be applicable BEFORE my application is reviewed

documents.content:
CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will
documents.path: /drives/b!nslWL7oJf0GurAFazjx4oOabfa0q4iZMh47wxSLJiqST3qiwOUFDQ6RKwkvmcuX4/root:/Chandler Creek HOA/Operations/Pool/Chandler Creek Pool Rules.pdf
documents.title: Chandler Creek Pool Rules.pdf

documents.content:
card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion. Please use caution.

resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit.

POOL ACCESS AGREEMENT

This pool access agreement (herein the “Agreement”) is entered into between Chandler Creek HOA (the “Association”) and the owner, or person 
authorized to engage in this agreement on owner’s behalf, including owners tenant, guests, or invitees (collectively referred to herein as “Grantee”) 
of property identified herein, whether such owner is a person, corporation, partnership, or other legal entity being granted access to an Association 
facility and/or purchasing an access device for use in relation to an Association facility.  The Association and Grantee are sometimes collectively 
referred to herein as the “Parties”. 

EFFECTIVE DATE: This agreement is to be effective as of the date shown below. 

CONSIDERATION AND RECEIPT: This agreement is entered into for the consideration of the representations, warranties, covenants, and agreements 
contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, including access to facilities that may be conditional by Association rule on the 
receipt of the signed agreement, payment of assessment, and payment for and/or receipt and programming of access device(s), the receipt and 
sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged. 

AUTHORITY: The undersigned signatories to this Agreement hereby represent and warrant that they are legally authorized to sign this Agreement 
and other contracts on behalf of the Parties.

tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be 
subject to loss of privileges for a period of time to be determined by the Association Board and other legal actions may be taken 
in conjunction with the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office. 
 

19. Swim safely and treat others as you would like to be treated.  Parents are responsible for the behavior of their children and/or 
their guests. 
 

20. In the event of inclement weather, swimmers are to clear the pool during the storm and for at least thirty (30) minutes after  
lightning and/or thunder has ceased.   
 

21. Any resident may call the current HOA management company to report unsafe behavior or violations of pool rules they witness.  
In case of an emergency, call 911.  An emergency call box is located right outside of the pool gates in the courtyard. 

 
22. Access to the multi-purpose room is by advance reservation only. 
 
Miscellaneous: 
 

Restrooms: The restroom fixtures are sanitized and cleaned by a private janitorial service.  The designated maintenance 
person/company is responsible for cleaning mirrors, counters, stocking hand towels, soap, emptying trash and cleaning the floors 
and toilets.  Please be mindful of the other Association members by cleaning up after yourself when using the restrooms.  If the 
restrooms should require attention, please notify the pool monitor on duty or call the current HOA management company. 
 
Penalties for Violation of Pool Rules: 
 

Depending upon severity of offense, action taken by the HOA for violation of HOA Pool Rules may include one or more of the 
following: 
 

 1st offense – A written warning will be issued (Notification of parents or guardian, when applicable). 

 2nd offense – A second written warning will be issued

CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will

documents.content:
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board's discretion. 

1. The Chandler Creek HOA swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pool.  No lifeguards are on duty.  Children 
under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule is 
strictly enforced. 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion. Please use caution. 

3. All Chandler Creek HOA residents are required to show their pool access pass device and a valid State of Texas ID if 
requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 

4. The access gates can only be opened with your assigned pool access device.  Gates are to remain closed/locked at all 
times.  The Pool Monitors have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access device.  Anyone 
without a pool access device will be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under 
no circumstances should the gate(s) be propped open.  There is a $20 replacement fee for lost/defective pool access 
devices. 

5. One household may host up to four (4) pool guests.  All pool guests must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA 
resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to always enforce the current pool rules.  Conduct by any person 
deemed to be dangerous, unreasonable, or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to 
the Pool Monitor.  Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the 
rest of the season. 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger.  Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries 
which would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult 
supervisor;
documents.path: /drives/b!nslWL7oJf0GurAFazjx4oOabfa0q4iZMh47wxSLJiqST3qiwOUFDQ6RKwkvmcuX4/root:/Chandler Creek HOA/Public/Community Info/Pool Waiver with Rules 2023.pdf

documents.content:
card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.

POOL ACCESS AGREEMENT

This pool access agreement (herein the “Agreement”) is entered into between Chandler Creek HOA (the “Association”) and the owner, or person 
authorized to engage in this agreement on owner’s behalf, including owners tenant, guests, or invitees (collectively referred to herein as “Grantee”) 
of property identified herein, whether such owner is a person, corporation, partnership, or other legal entity being granted access to an Association 
facility and/or purchasing an access device for use in relation to an Association facility.  The Association and Grantee are sometimes collectively 
referred to herein as the “Parties”. 

EFFECTIVE DATE: This agreement is to be effective as of the date shown below. 

CONSIDERATION AND RECEIPT: This agreement is entered into for the consideration of the representations, warranties, covenants, and agreements 
contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, including access to facilities that may be conditional by Association rule on the 
receipt of the signed agreement, payment of assessment, and payment for and/or receipt and programming of access device(s), the receipt and 
sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged. 

AUTHORITY: The undersigned signatories to this Agreement hereby represent and warrant that they are legally authorized to sign this Agreement 
and other contracts on behalf of the Parties.

etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.  No alcoholic beverages or glass containers allowed 
 

12. All coolers, ice-chests, and bags will be subject to search in order to adhere to the “no alcohol” rule. 
 

13. No littering.  All trash generated by swimmers must be placed in garbage containers or otherwise properly disposed of. 
 

14. No flotation devices allowed (EXCEPTIONS: arm floaties and toddler life preservers). 
 



   

15. Proper swim attire must be worn at all times (infants and toddlers included).  No cut-offs, thongs or street clothes will be 
allowed in the pool. 
 

16. Children who are not toilet-trained are not allowed in the main pool or the kiddy pool without a “swim” diaper and must be 
accompanied by an adult within arm’s length at all times.  Children wearing regular diapers will not be allowed in either the 
main pool or the kiddy pool.  “Swim” diapers must be used at all times.  If your child or anyone else in your party is found to be 
responsible for a closure due to fecal matter, all costs to clean and reopen the pool may be assigned to your family.  If a fecal 
accident occurs: All swimmers must exit the pool immediately and the pool will be closed for the minimum time frame as 
allowed by law from the time the pool has been chemically treated.  Incidents should be immediately reported to the current 
HOA management company. 
 

17. Persons having currently active diarrhea or who have had active diarrhea within the previous 14 days shall not be allowed to 
enter the pool water.   
 

18. No smoking or any other use of tobacco products (Skoal®, chewing tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be

documents.content:
up, etc.    

6) Exact visits per month may vary based on fluctuating weeks in any given month per year.   

Weekly services in off season are only twice monthly for all areas; therefore, specific 

services will be performed at Company discretion, so site may not have the same 

“finished” appearance during these times.   

7) Dumped and/or piled debris to be addressed as a separate issue with Property 

Management/Board as and when needed. 

 

SCHEDULE OF SERVICES 

 



Chandler Creek HOA Landscape Management Agreement 8/31/22 

   5  

TURF AREAS 

1) Policing of landscaped areas for minor debris and litter prior to mowing.  Company does 

not clean up or remove biohazards such as personal hygiene items, needles, etc. 

2) Areas with excessive pet waste will not be serviced that week.  Company cannot service 

areas with pets in them, regardless of the “friendliness” of the animal. Should either of 

these situations occur the Property Management will be notified in order that the situation 

can be corrected prior to the next scheduled visit. 

3) Company will clean up all debris generated during its performance of duties while on 

site.    Porter service is not part of this agreement. 

4) Mowing, edging, and trimming of turf areas weekly, if needed, during growing season. 

5) Clippings will not be caught and removed; however, excessive clippings will be removed 

if needed, to avoid damage to turf. 

6) All turf mowing to be done utilizing rotary type mowers. 

7) Mow patterns will be altered, when possible, to help prevent wheel depressions in turf. 

8) Mow heights to be adjusted based on turf type, season, and overall condition of turf. 

9) All attempts to avoid removing more than one-third (1/3) of the existing growth during 

visits will be made.  Use of specific types of equipment will be utilized and/or adjusted 

to minimize scalping and always perform best practices for the turf.

documents.content:
card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.

documents.content:
2  

10) Clean up of all landscape debris generated during regular maintenance visits, to include 

leaves, small limbs, twigs, etc., to be cleaned up as part of regular service in areas as 

maintained   Leaves may be mulched on site at Company discretion if it will not affect 

health of turf areas. 

11) Inclement weather/Holiday schedule: In the event inclement weather/holiday should fall 

on scheduled service day; services will resume the following week on normal day. 

12) Company normally closes operations during Christmas week to allow our employees 

time with their families.  No work will be performed during this timeframe. 

13) If any areas or services are not able to be performed during regular scheduled visits due 

to anything beyond Company control, i.e., excessive water, inaccessible gated areas, 

pets/people in the area such as a customer functions, etc.; then that service or area will 

be performed during the next regular scheduled visit.  Company will ask the people to 

move until we are completed with services for that visit and customer will be notified of 

any issues that may interfere with the performance of Company services. 

SERVICE AREAS 

1) Landscape Maintenance proposal is based forty-two (42) visits per annum as listed for 

all common areas as shown in green on the embedded map.   

2) If Company is unable to access or perform any service during a regular schedule 

maintenance visit, due to no fault of the Company, then Company will not return until 

next scheduled visit to complete the areas that are locked, have pets/people present, i.e., 

customer function, or with excessive pet waste, biohazards, excessive debris, etc.  

3) Company does not move tables, chairs, picnic tables, trampolines, etc. from and/or 

around in communal areas to complete service in said areas.  Areas with these types of 

items may not be able to be completely serviced and management will be notified.

art”, signs, figurines, etc. that may be damaged during normal use of landscape 

equipment to include but not limited to blowers, weed eaters, etc. 

5) Pesticides, fertilizers, etc. will not be applied if animals/people are present and since they 

are time sensitive certain areas may not receive important services, i.e., pre-emergent, 

fire ant treatment, etc. in the correct timeframe.

EXPLANATION OF SCHEDULE 

1) Schedule is a basic guideline for services and subject to change based upon best 

agronomic practices.  Any major changes will be addressed with Customer ahead of time. 

2) Application date for fertilizer, mulch installation, weed control, fungicide, etc. are 

subject to change based on weather conditions, leaf drop, etc. and agronomic needs and 

do not affect the scope of work for this agreement. 

3) Areas with forty-two (42) visits means all services to performed weekly as needed during 

the growing season, which is roughly the first or second week of March thru about the 

third or fourth week of October.   



Chandler Creek HOA Landscape Management Agreement 8/31/22 

   4  

4) Areas listed as monthly will be most likely be done the same week each month, weather 

permitting.   

5) The “off-season” is considered November- February.   Off season visits will consist only 

with mowing only as needed and includes detail work of beds, trees, trash clean up, etc.    

6) Exact visits per month may vary based on fluctuating weeks in any given month per year.   

Weekly services in off season are only twice monthly for all areas; therefore, specific

documents.content:
CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will

documents.title: Chandler Creek Pool Rules.pdf

1. The Chandler Creek HOA swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pool.  No lifeguards are on duty.  Children 
under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule is 
strictly enforced. 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion. Please use caution. 

3. All Chandler Creek HOA residents are required to show their pool access pass device and a valid State of Texas ID if 
requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 

4. The access gates can only be opened with your assigned pool access device.  Gates are to remain closed/locked at all 
times.  The Pool Monitors have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access device.  Anyone 
without a pool access device will be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under 
no circumstances should the gate(s) be propped open.  There is a $20 replacement fee for lost/defective pool access 
devices. 

5. One household may host up to four (4) pool guests.  All pool guests must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA 
resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to always enforce the current pool rules.  Conduct by any person 
deemed to be dangerous, unreasonable, or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to 
the Pool Monitor.  Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the 
rest of the season. 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger.  Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries 
which would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult 
supervisor;

referred to herein as the “Parties”. 

EFFECTIVE DATE: This agreement is to be effective as of the date shown below.

and other contracts on behalf of the Parties.

ONLY RESIDENTS WHO HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS ARE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL 

AND TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not 
explicitly covered by these and other rules.  They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings 
should be taken to HOA management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitor(s).  Pool Monitors 
are authorized to enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these pool rules will be reported to the HOA Board, 
HOA management company and/or the Williamson County Sheriff's Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board's discretion. 

1. The Chandler Creek HOA swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pool.  No lifeguards are on duty.  Children

documents.content:
tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be 
subject to loss of privileges for a period of time to be determined by the Association Board and other legal actions may be taken 
in conjunction with the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office. 
 

19. Swim safely and treat others as you would like to be treated.  Parents are responsible for the behavior of their children and/or 
their guests. 
 

20. In the event of inclement weather, swimmers are to clear the pool during the storm and for at least thirty (30) minutes after  
lightning and/or thunder has ceased.   
 

21. Any resident may call the current HOA management company to report unsafe behavior or violations of pool rules they witness.  
In case of an emergency, call 911.  An emergency call box is located right outside of the pool gates in the courtyard. 

 
22. Access to the multi-purpose room is by advance reservation only. 
 
Miscellaneous: 
 

Restrooms: The restroom fixtures are sanitized and cleaned by a private janitorial service.  The designated maintenance 
person/company is responsible for cleaning mirrors, counters, stocking hand towels, soap, emptying trash and cleaning the floors 
and toilets.  Please be mindful of the other Association members by cleaning up after yourself when using the restrooms.  If the 
restrooms should require attention, please notify the pool monitor on duty or call the current HOA management company. 
 
Penalties for Violation of Pool Rules: 
 

Depending upon severity of offense, action taken by the HOA for violation of HOA Pool Rules may include one or more of the 
following: 
 

 1st offense – A written warning will be issued (Notification of parents or guardian, when applicable). 

 2nd offense – A second written warning will be issued

card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.

Revised 02-23-2023. 

 

• Alcohol may not be served or consumed on any CCHOA premises (including the parking lot).  The entire 
CCHOA property is SMOKE FREE. 

• Pets are not allowed anywhere in the entire amenity center at any time. 

• NO EXCLUSIVE USE OF THE POOL comes with a reservation of multi-purpose room.  Should your event 
occur during seasonal pool operating hours, all CCHOA Pool Rules and Regulations apply.  No pool 
furniture is to be brought into the multi-purpose room. 

• Miscellaneous decorations require prior approval. Scotch tape, masking tape, duct tape may never be 
used on the facility walls, doors, windows, or fixtures.  The only allowable tape is “painters’ tape”.  Any 
allowed decorations, and their support system, must be removed before exiting the multi-purpose room. 

• Parking must be in the parking lot or other designated parking areas.  No parking in the circle drive in front 
of the amenity center or on grass areas.  Parking is for registered owners, tenants and guests and is 
available on a first come, first served basis. 

• Noise level should be kept to a minimum.  Williamson County noise ordinances will be enforced. 

• Registered homeowner or tenant is responsible for the actions of all their guests.  In the event of a 
disturbance or other unruly behavior, the Board and/or its security company may shut down the event 
and request everyone to depart the premises.  All rulings are final and shall not be debated with HOA 
representatives (Board or security). 

 

Please note: The Board reserves the right to revise/amend these rules at any time without prior notice. 
 
  



Revised 02-23-2023.

etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.  No alcoholic beverages or glass containers allowed 
 

12. All coolers, ice-chests, and bags will be subject to search in order to adhere to the “no alcohol” rule. 
 

13. No littering.  All trash generated by swimmers must be placed in garbage containers or otherwise properly disposed of. 
 

14. No flotation devices allowed (EXCEPTIONS: arm floaties and toddler life preservers). 
 



   

15. Proper swim attire must be worn at all times (infants and toddlers included).  No cut-offs, thongs or street clothes will be 
allowed in the pool. 
 

16. Children who are not toilet-trained are not allowed in the main pool or the kiddy pool without a “swim” diaper and must be 
accompanied by an adult within arm’s length at all times.  Children wearing regular diapers will not be allowed in either the 
main pool or the kiddy pool.  “Swim” diapers must be used at all times.  If your child or anyone else in your party is found to be 
responsible for a closure due to fecal matter, all costs to clean and reopen the pool may be assigned to your family.  If a fecal 
accident occurs: All swimmers must exit the pool immediately and the pool will be closed for the minimum time frame as 
allowed by law from the time the pool has been chemically treated.  Incidents should be immediately reported to the current 
HOA management company. 
 

17. Persons having currently active diarrhea or who have had active diarrhea within the previous 14 days shall not be allowed to 
enter the pool water.   
 

18. No smoking or any other use of tobacco products (Skoal®, chewing tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be
