documents.content:
in Declaration §8.10.  This is outlined in §4.01 
of the bylaws.    

Attorney Credentials 

Niemann & Heyer LLP has been representing POAs and specializing in POA law for more than 20 years.  Our 
lawyers have been instrumental in drafting virtually all POA law in Texas, including the Texas Uniform Condominium 
Act (Property Code Chapter 82) and the Texas Residential Property Owners Protection Act (Property Code Chapter 
209).  Connie Niemann Heyer is a past president of the Austin chapter of the Community Associations Institute, and 
is a founding board member of the Texas Community Association Advocates.   

The Board of Directors hopes this short letter boosts your confidence that the Board is performing their 
role in the Association appropriately, in accordance with our DCCR, & in accordance with Law. All Board 
meetings are open to property owners, and the board welcomes any homeowners that attend. 

Sincerely,

documents.content:
Internal Use - Confidential 

Annual Lookout at Brushy Creek Property Owners Association  
Board Meeting   Tuesday, September 13, 2022 

New Life Baptist Church  19715 Hodde Lane, Pflugerville  
 
Annual HOA Welcome & Call to Order @ 7:00 PM 
 
It was established that a quorum was present, and the annual meeting would be held as scheduled. 
 
Board Members Present 

Rhonda Kitchens   Valerie Phillips 
Jeff Lathan    Ron Nash 
Butch Miller   Brian Ritter 
Rick Zilem, Community Manager 

 
September 14, 2021 Annual Meeting Minutes 

Motion to accept Annual Meeting minutes – Brian Ritter 
Second by Ron Nash 
Motion Approved 

 
Guest Speakers 

 Eric Woods, Hutto ESD Fire Marshall - Spoke on Fire Safety 

Russ Boles, County Commissioner – Discussed CR198 Bridge Repair, SE Loop segments & 
Williamson County Long Range Plan 

  
Annual Manager’s Report 

Rick Zilem presented annual Manager’s/Financial report  
Motion to accept – Mary Peck 
Second by Ron Nash 
Motion Approved   

 
ACC Report – Joel Enderson, Chairman 

       Joel presented a short summary of the actions and issues that the ACC dealt with throughout  
       this year.  It was noted that Joel was stepping down after many years of serving on the board 
       and ACC.  This will leave one open position for the board to fill.   
 
Election of Officers 
      There were four (4) open spots on the Board.  The nominees were Jeff Lathan, Valerie Phillips, 
      Pam Ferrill and Ron Pepper.  Motions to accept nominees by acclimation by Dutch DeHart and 
      Mary Peck. 
 

 
 



 

Internal Use - Confidential 

Homeowners Topics 

      The floor was opened to members to present questions about topics from homeowners. 

  

Meeting adjourned at 8:25 p.m. 

Executive Session called at 8:25 p.m. for board member positions: 

Rhonda Kitchens, President   Brian Ritter, Vice President 

Pam Ferrill, Secretary    Robert Alfaro, Treasurer 

Valerie Phillips, Communications  Jeff Lathan, Member at Large

Areas to Improve
• New Home construction 6 month enclosure obligation is

• Enforcement of 50' rear boundary setback for sheds (see 
DCCR section 3.03).

• A surveyor-produced plat may not capture all the build 
line setback.

All improvements require ACC approval.
Application needs complete details of construction.

provided, however, thai Developer reserves the exclusive right to erect, place and 
maintain such facilities in or upon any portion of the Subdivision as in its sole discretion may be necessary or 
convenient while selling Tracts, selling or constructing residences and constructing other improvements within the 
Subdivision. 

Section 3.05 Walls and Fences. Walls and fences, if any, must be approved prior to construction by the 
Architectural Control Committee and shall not be closer to front property lines than the front line of the house on 
all Tracts except those that front Brushy Creek Trail. Tracts that front Brushy Creek Trail must rlace the fence 
along the front property line and said fence must be of the smne material <tnd style as the subdivision fence along 
county road 139 and 198. llo\\'cver, a maximum height or any fence shall be six (6) feel. No barbed, smooth. ho!!. 
chicken. chain link or like material/wire fencing is permillcd on the property, except on (5) five acre tracts or lar!!e~·. 
the rear and side lot lines may be fenced with smooth or barbed wire. All mailboxes must be of maso~1ry 
construction and approved by the Architectural Control Committee. 

Section 3.06 Prohibition of Olfensive Activities. No Activity, whether for profit or not, shall be conducted on any 
Tract which is not related to single family residential purposes, unless said activity meets the following criteria: (a) 
no additional exterior sign of activity is present, (b) it is the type of action that usually happens in a home, (c) no 
additional traffic, that would not be there normally, is created, (d) the entity or activity maintains an office or place 
of business elsewhere, and (c) nothing dangerous is present that shouldn't be there. This restriction is waived in 
regard to the customary sales activities required to sell homes in the Subdivision. The discharoe or use of fireanns 
is expressly prohibited.

Rules.Architectural Committee Rules for The 
Hills of Lakeway will be known as the "Architectural Committee Rule Book", 
or "Architectural Committee Rule Book". A current copy of the Architectural 
Committee Rule Book can be found on The Hills POA website. 

B. Amended Master Declaration. "Amended Master Declaration" will mean 
The Hills of Lakeway Amended Master Declaration of Covenants, 
Conditions, Restrictions and Property Owners' Association and all 
amendments thereto. 

C. Architectural Committee. "Architectural Committee" will be defined inthe 
Amended Master Declaration in Article VI 11. 

D. Association. "Association" will mean The Hills of Lakeway Property 
Owners' Association, Inc., (POA), a Texas non-profit corporation, and its 
successors or assigns, (hereinafter sometimes "POA"). 

2 



2023036320 Page 7 of 84 

E. Bond. A bond will mean a surety bond, which is a promise to pay one party 
(the Obligee) a certain amount if a second party (the principal) failsto meet 
an obligation, such as fulfilling the terms of the contract. The surety bond 
protects the obligee against losses resulting from the principal's failure to 
meet the obligation. Bonds will be required for new home construction, pool 
construction and most renovation/remodeling projects. The Association will 
determine the amount of the Bond. 

F. Building Permit. A "Permit or Building Permit" will be defined as a 
document issued by the Association or its agent to a property owner for a 
project, which has been approved by the Architectural Committee. The 
project shall mean newconstruction or an improvement to the property. The 
Association will determine which projects require a permit. 

G. Certificate of Completion. "Certificate of Completion" or "CC" will mean 
the document prepared by The Hills of Lakeway Property Owners 
Association that is issued only when construction of a structure is complete, 
approved by the contract building inspectors, and inspected andapproved

planted trees and shrubs, poles, signs, exterior air conditioning, water 
softener, fixtures or equipment, pumps, wells, tanks, reservoirs, pipes,

water meter, sewer, gas, electric, telephone, regularor cable television, or

•                   (initial) Pass Through Rule - The Hills and Flintrock Falls communities have 
reciprocal agreements that preclude residents from transiting through the others' community 
using the shared gate within five (5) minutes of entering the others’ community.  The shared 
gates are located at the intersection of Jack Nicklaus Drive / Tiburon Drive and The Hills 
Drive.  
  
                  (initial) If a Hills RFID tag holder enters the Flintrock community through either the 
Jack Nicklaus or Honors gates and passes through the gate exits for the Flintrock Community 
through the shared gate or, if a Hills RFID tag holder enters the Flintrock community through 
the shared gate and exists the Flintrock Community through either the Jack Nicklaus or 
Honors gates within a five (5) minute span, access to the shared gates will be suspended.  
  

This information is extracted from the Rules and Regulations, The Hills of Lakeway Property 
Association, Inc. dated September 7, 2016.  The full document is available online, from our 
Property Manager or the gate Security team.

documents.content:
The Hills POA Courtesy Policy 
effective July 28, 2015 

 
While the overwhelming majority of Hills residents are courteous to the security guards, there 
have been an increasing number of incidents of residents being abusive to our guards and 
representatives of the POA.   
 
The POA Board defines “abusive” as mistreatment and/or disrespect of security  personnel, 
including guards and their supervisors, and all representatives of the POA. “Abusive” includes, 
but is not limited to: 
 

 Failure to treat said persons in a courteous and respectful manner 

 Use foul or profane language 

 Threats of physical well-being 

 Threats of loss of employment 
 

Your POA Board takes this unacceptable behavior seriously. Some guards have left because of 
this treatment and some security personnel are choosing not to work here because of some 
residents behavior.  
 
In the event of abuse of the guards by a resident, the POA Board has taken the following 
actions : 
 

1. The new RFID Agreement requires a signature for purchasers of RFID tags. It states: 
 

Requires a Resident, Resident’s family, and invitees and/or contractors to at all times 
treat the security personnel hired by the POA and all representatives of the POA in a 
courteous and respectful manner. Failure to do so shall result in disabling of the 
RFID tag without notice.” 

 
2. The Rules & Regulations of The Hills of Lakeway Property Owners’ Association, Inc. 

are being amended to include the following: 
 

“Residents, members, guests or contractors that are verbally abusive to The Hills 
Security Officers [and POA representatives (revision to be made to R&R)] are 
subject to loss of RFID privileges for 30 days.  If repeated violations are observed, all 
RFID privileges will be suspended indefinitely. Loss of RFID gate access requires 
those vehicles to enter at manned gates only and does not deny access to the 
community.”

extracted.answer: Household pets like dogs and cats are allowed. No commercial breeding, boarding, poultry, livestock, or exotic/dangerous animals are permitted. Pets must be kept under control, leashed when outside the owner's unit, and not allowed to roam.
documents_found: MST Declaration and Master Deed Recorded.pdf
extracted.quote: The keeping of ordinary household pets such as dogs and cats is allowed; however, no breeding, raising, or boarding of such pets for commercial purposes is permitted. No poultry or other livestock, and no exotic or dangerous animals, may be kept on the Project. Animals shall be kept under control at all times and, when not in the Owner's Unit, shall be restrained by a leash or under the direct control of the Owner. No animal shall be allowed to roam or run at large.
extracted.source: MST Declaration and Master Deed Recorded.pdf
extracted.summary: Hills of Lakeway allows standard household pets with strict control and leashing requirements, prohibiting commercial pet activities and dangerous/exotic animals.

documents.content:
• 

I 

(f) No oil drilling, oil development operation, oil refining, quarrying or 
mining operations of any kind shall be permitted on the surface of the Property. No oil 
wells, tanks, tunnels, mineral excavations or shafts shall be permitted upon or in any part 
of the Property. No derrick or other structure designed for use in quarrying or boring for 
oil, natural gas or other minerals shall be erected, maintained or permitted on the 
Property. 

(g) No animals, livestock, fowl or poultry of any kind shall be raised, bred or 
kept on the Property, except that dogs, cats or other household pets may be kept for the 
purpose of providing companionship for the private family. Animals are notto be raised, 
bred or kept for commercial purposes or for food. It is the purpose of these provisions to 
restrict the use of the Property so that no person shall quarter on any part of the Property 
cows, horses, bees, pigeons, hogs, sheep, goats, guinea fowls, ducks, chickens, turkeys, 
skunks or any other animals that may interfere with the quietude, health or safety of the 
community. No more than three pets will be permitted on each Lot. Pets must be 
restrained or confined to the rear of the Owner's Lot inside a fenced area or Vlithin the 
house. It is the pet owner's responsibility to keep the Lot clean and free of pet debris. All 
animals must be properly tagged for identification and vaccinated against rabies. 

(h) No Lot or other area on the Property shall be used as a dumping ground 
for rubbish or a site for the accumulation of unsightly materials of any kind, including, 
but not limited to, broken or rusty equipment, disassembled or inoperative cars and 
discarded appliances and furniture. Trash, garbage or other waste shall not be kept 
except in sanitary containers. All equipment for the storage or other disposal of such 
material shall be kept in clean and sanitary condition. All containers and other facilities

gliders, trucks, automobiles, graders, boats, tractors, pickups, mobile homes, trailers, 
buses, campers, recreational vehicles, bicycles, motorcycles, motor scooters, and wagons 
shall be subject to the Hills of Lakeway Rules, which may regulate, prohibit or limit the 
use thereof within specified parts of the Hills of Lakeway, and also to the rules of the 
Association, which may impose additional restrictions upon the use of such vehicles on 
the Condominium Property. In addition to the foregoing, and without limiting the 
generality thereof, the parking of vehicles of any type or description whatsoever upon 
the private or public roads or rights-of-way within the Hills of Lakeway or the 
Condominium Property shall be prohibited, except within enclosed garage spaces of any 
Unit or parking areas designated as Limited Common Elements. No recreational 
vehicle, house trailer, or other moveable enclosure shall be used as a place of residence, 
either permanent or temporary, anywhere on the Condominium Property.

7.12. Animals. No kennel or other facility for raising or boarding dogs or other 
animals for commercial purposes shall be kept on the Condominium Property. The 
keeping of ordinary household pets such as dogs and cats is allowed; however, no 
breeding, raising, or boarding of such pets for commercial purposes is permitted. No 
poultry or other livestock, and no exotic or dangerous animals, may be kept on the 
Project. Animals shall be kept under control at all times and, when not in the Owner's 
Unit, shall be restrained by a leash or under the direct control of the Owner. No 
animal shall be allowed to roam or run at large.

transportation shall be expressly prohibited from parking on either public or private roads or

prohibitions of this section and exceptions may be granted for parking in the right-of-way for 
moving vans and certain service vehicles.

or multi-family site. Animals shall be kept under control at all times and, when not upon the 
Owner's premises, shall be restrained by a leash or under the direct control of the Owner. No 
animal shall be allowed to roam or run at large.

a nonexclusive easement to use the private ways located within the Hills of Lakeway for the 
purposes of walking thereon or traveling thereon by appropriate means. Each Owner may permit 
guests and invitees to use the private ways within the development for such purposes. The rights 
and easements herein granted shall be appurtenant to and assignable with the property with 
respect to which it is granted, but shall not otherwise be assignable. Use of private ways shall be

documents.content:
common interest real estate developments and a wide variety of other for-profit entities.  TxR Reserve Studies meet and exceed state statute requirements.
TxR business is strictly reserve studies.  We are not involved in other unrelated fields such as the business of construction defect investigation or consulting.  We believe that providing reserve studies is a demanding specialty in itself and requires focus and purpose.  As a result of that belief, we are certain that you will find the TxR Reserve Study to be the leading product in the industry that provides the client with a clear, concise and easy to understand picture of the development’s component and funding needs.
The preparer has a bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from Texas A&M University.  He has over 45 years of diversified experience in construction, operations and maintenance of structures, buildings, grounds and roadways.  He has many years of experience in supervising and preparing operations and capital budgets for extensive building complexes.  He is a member of the Community Associations Institute and has been designated as a Reserve Specialist (RS) and has been permitted as a Reserve Study Specialist (RSS) in the state of Nevada.  He has been preparing reserve studies and budgets for Homeowner Associations since 2000, including large and complex projects in Park City, Utah, Las Vegas, Nevada, and Austin, Texas.

Upon review of our proposal, you will uncover how LandCare will create a long-lasting relationship 
with the attention to detail the community deserves. We have a proven track record in Austin of 
understanding expectations by responsiveness and communication. Our experienced team of

in a fine and suspension of the RFID access privileges through 
all gates. Access to the community is still available through a guard-controlled entrance  
(Lohman’s Crossing or Club Estates).  

•                   (initial) Pass Through Rule - The Hills and Flintrock Falls communities have 
reciprocal agreements that preclude residents from transiting through the others' community 
using the shared gate within five (5) minutes of entering the others’ community.  The shared 
gates are located at the intersection of Jack Nicklaus Drive / Tiburon Drive and The Hills 
Drive.  
  
                  (initial) If a Hills RFID tag holder enters the Flintrock community through either the 
Jack Nicklaus or Honors gates and passes through the gate exits for the Flintrock Community 
through the shared gate or, if a Hills RFID tag holder enters the Flintrock community through 
the shared gate and exists the Flintrock Community through either the Jack Nicklaus or 
Honors gates within a five (5) minute span, access to the shared gates will be suspended.  
  

This information is extracted from the Rules and Regulations, The Hills of Lakeway Property 
Association, Inc. dated September 7, 2016.  The full document is available online, from our 
Property Manager or the gate Security team.

documents.content:
The Hills POA Courtesy Policy 
effective July 28, 2015 

 
While the overwhelming majority of Hills residents are courteous to the security guards, there 
have been an increasing number of incidents of residents being abusive to our guards and 
representatives of the POA.   
 
The POA Board defines “abusive” as mistreatment and/or disrespect of security  personnel, 
including guards and their supervisors, and all representatives of the POA. “Abusive” includes, 
but is not limited to: 
 

 Failure to treat said persons in a courteous and respectful manner 

 Use foul or profane language 

 Threats of physical well-being 

 Threats of loss of employment 
 

Your POA Board takes this unacceptable behavior seriously. Some guards have left because of 
this treatment and some security personnel are choosing not to work here because of some 
residents behavior.  
 
In the event of abuse of the guards by a resident, the POA Board has taken the following 
actions : 
 

1. The new RFID Agreement requires a signature for purchasers of RFID tags. It states: 
 

Requires a Resident, Resident’s family, and invitees and/or contractors to at all times 
treat the security personnel hired by the POA and all representatives of the POA in a 
courteous and respectful manner. Failure to do so shall result in disabling of the 
RFID tag without notice.” 

 
2. The Rules & Regulations of The Hills of Lakeway Property Owners’ Association, Inc. 

are being amended to include the following: 
 

“Residents, members, guests or contractors that are verbally abusive to The Hills 
Security Officers [and POA representatives (revision to be made to R&R)] are 
subject to loss of RFID privileges for 30 days.  If repeated violations are observed, all 
RFID privileges will be suspended indefinitely. Loss of RFID gate access requires 
those vehicles to enter at manned gates only and does not deny access to the 
community.”

Subject: Landscape Agreement

Dear Macie Hatch and Board of Directors,

Thank you for the opportunity to provide a landscaping and grounds maintenance proposal for The 
Hills of Lakeway POA. My team and I have carefully evaluated the scope of work and we are 
confident in our ability to enhance the beauty of your landscape.

Upon review of our proposal, you will uncover how LandCare will create a long-lasting relationship 
with the attention to detail the community deserves. We have a proven track record in Austin of 
understanding expectations by responsiveness and communication. Our experienced team of 
professionals strives to provide the best quality in the market while doing so with great value.

Thank you for considering LandCare as a valued partner for The Hills of Lakeway POA, we look 
forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

Alec Ryan, Branch Manager

documents.content:
tables and chairs must be wiped clean.
(c) The kitchen must be properly cleaned and returned to its original condition. Any food brought in must be
removed from the refrigerator and or freezer.
(d) Trash cans indoors and outdoors are to be emptied and trash placed in the trash bins located in parking lot.
(e) Restrooms trash cans emptied and countertops wiped down.
(f) All furniture must be returned to its original position.
(g) All greenery, flowers, decorations and other items brought in must be removed.
(h) Pavilion, if used, should be swept, all trash cans emptied and furniture put back to its original place.
(i) All lights, appliances and fans must be turned off.
Failure to strictly comply with the cleaning requirements will result in forfeit of security deposit.

Damages: The ROA Member will be held responsible for any damage caused by the member and or their
guests. The breach or violation of any condition set forth herein may result in the loss of the security deposit,
the imposition of liability on the ROA Member, and possible denial of future rentals of the Clubhouse.

Right of Refusal: The Association reserves the right to refuse to rent the facilities for any purpose it deems to
be detrimental to or not in the best interests of its members. It further reserves the right to refuse to rent the
facilities on any dates and at any time it deems inappropriate or inconvenient to residents of La Ventana.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 3



La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

● The LaVentana swimming pools are SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pools.

● The swimming pools are for the use of the ROA Members and their invited guests only.

● Pool hours are from 6 am - 10 pm. Maximum guests per household is 12.

● Pools may not be used along with a clubhouse reservation or rental. Pools remain open to residents
at all times

● Leave gates closed. DO NOT prop them open.

documents.title: La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules Regulations and Pool Rules 10.23.pdf

documents.content:
La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

The following rules shall govern rentals of the Clubhouse for private events.

Reserved Space: A La Ventana Ranch Owners Association Member ROA Member (“ROA Member”), may
reserve the Clubhouse for a private event. In the context of rentals, the “Clubhouse” is the space that includes
the sitting room with fireplace, main room with TV and pool table, kitchen, restrooms and pavilion. It does not
include the pool, spas, exercise rooms, playground, tennis courts, golf range, and creek areas. These areas are
not available for reserving and shall remain available to all La Ventana Residents during any private event at
the Clubhouse.

Pool Usage: Pool usage during an event in which the clubhouse has been reserved / rented is NOT
allowed. ROA Members are responsible for their invited guests and that they follow rules. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries for members and or their guests while using
The clubhouse, pools and surrounding areas. The ROA Members using the pools are responsible for any
damages that may occur while they or their invited guests are using the pool.

Access. Only a ROA Member may rent the clubhouse.
(a) The ROA Member must be in good standing at the time the reservation is made and at the date and time in
which the event takes place. Should the ROA Member not be in good standing, the Homeowners Association
reserves the right to not allow the event to take place. .
(b) The ROA Member shall access the clubhouse with their assigned key card. The ROA member must be
present at all times during any use of the clubhouse and shall be personally responsible for the behavior of their
guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, deposit shall be forfeited.

Wednesday, October 2nd at 6:30PM, La Ventana Clubhouse

• Board of Directors Election & Annual Meeting: Wednesday, October 23rd at 6:30PM, La Ventana Clubhouse

Updates & Reminders Continued



As the La Ventana Ranch Owners’ Association (LVROA) continues to work diligently to preserve the beauty and 
harmony of our community, it has become evident that updates to the Codes, Covenants, and Restrictions (CCRs) 
are necessary. These changes aim to ensure that our neighborhood remains a desirable place to live, maintaining 
both its aesthetics and property values. As most of you are aware, the CCR’s are the tools used by your HOA Board 
to govern the use of a property in a community, and maintain consistency in property appearance, construction, 
maintenance, etc. These rules exist to protect property values and maintain consistency in the community. CC&Rs 
can include rules about, among other things: 

• Fences 
• Garbage cans Business openings
• Maintaining animals, livestock, etc.
• Unsightly or abandoned vehicles, trailers, etc., and
• New construction of homes or improvements.

By updating the CCRs, the Board is given the tools necessary to preserve the integrity of La Ventana Ranch, 
protecting property values and ensuring the long-term appeal of our neighborhood. These changes will help avoid 
situations where neglected properties or unapproved modifications negatively impact surrounding homes. Our CCRs 
have been in existence for many years and can be viewed on the website of PS Property Management, our new 
property management company. More information on these more global amendments will be forthcoming next year. 
In the meantime, there is one amendment that will be necessary on a more urgent basis to address unclear language 
within the CCR’s which may inadvertently allow Airbnb and Vrbo vacation home rentals to exist within the La Ventana 
community.

at the time in which the rental reservation is made. Security deposits are due one week
prior to the event. Once the reservation is made and payment is made your event is guaranteed. Failure to pay
the fees prior to the event, will be deemed to voluntary cancellation of the reservation. Payments for the rental
fees must be made online through Town Square.
(e) Refund of Security Deposit. The security deposit will be refunded if the Clubhouse and its contents are not
damaged and are in accordance with these conditions and to the satisfaction of the clubhouse committee
member. Damage to the Clubhouse or its contents, or failure to comply with these conditions will result in
forfeiture of the security deposit. The ROA Member will be responsible and liable for any damage that exceeds
the amount of the security deposit.

Supplies: The ROA Member is responsible for bringing their own supplies for their event. Replacement trash
bags for outdoor cans and indoor cans can be found in the pantry. Should you use any of the supplies in the
kitchen they are to be cleaned and put back where found.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 2



Clean Up: The ROA Member is fully responsible for removal of all trash and garbage from the inside of the
clubhouse, pavilion area and any other areas that may have been used during the event. Cleanup is to be done
the same day of the event. Failure to do so will result in forfeit of Security Deposit. All equipment, flowers,
caterer related items must be removed the same day of the event unless prearranged with the Clubhouse
Committee Member. Failure to do so may result in forfeit of security deposit.

Holidays: The clubhouse may not be reserved or rented on the following Holidays: Valentines Day, Easter,
Memorial Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, or New Years Eve. The intent of this clause is to
permit usage for LaVentana Community Events, on these particular Holidays.

(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.
(d) The clubhouse is for Association Members and their guests to enjoy, the clubhouse may not be rented two
consecutive nights after 4:00 pm by the same resident.

Guests: A “Guest” is any person invited and that attends an event. Another La Ventana resident attending the
event is considered a “Guest” of the event and included in the guest count. The maximum number of Guests
is 50 people. The ROA Member is responsible for the strict adherence to these limitations. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries of members and or their guests while using
the clubhouse and surrounding property.

Reservations: Please email lvclubhouserental@gmail.com to make arrangements for renting the Clubhouse.
Requests can also be made online through Town Square. A walk through with a Clubhouse Committee
Member will be required. Rental payments are to be made online through Town Square before the event can
take place. Should the event be canceled the full rental payment will be returned. The deposit in the form of a
check payable to LaVentana ROA will be held by the Clubhouse Committee Member and returned to the
resident once the event is over and all is satisfactory with the clubhouse.

Hours: Clubhouse hours are 5:30am to 10:30 pm. All persons must vacate the Clubhouse at 10:30 pm.
Entering and or remaining at the clubhouse after 10:30 pm may result in loss of privileges.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 1



Thermostat: During the COOLER months, return the HEAT to 62 degrees. During theWARMER months,
return the AC to 78 degrees.

Parking: ROA Members and their Guests should park at the clubhouse parking lot. Parking on the street and or
grassy areas is prohibited.

Pets: No pets are permitted indoors.

4874‐3371‐3441v.6 53762‐1 10/13/2024 

RENTAL AND LEASING RULES 

Rental and Leasing Rules 

The  following  rules  are  adopted  by  the  La Ventan Ranch Owners  Association,  Inc.  (the  
“Association”) and shall apply to every owner (“Owner”) of a lot (“Lot”) in La Ventana ROA.  

Leasing Requirements. The rental or lease of any Lot must comply with the following rules: 

1. Minimum Lease Term. Any lease must be for an initial term of not less than ninety (90) 
days. The foregoing  leasing restriction shall not apply to an Owner who, following the 
sale of a Lot, leases the Lot back from the purchaser.

2. Entire Lot Leased. A Lot may be  leased only  in  its entirety; no fraction or portion of a 
Lot may be leased.

3. Lease to be in Writing. The lease must be in writing.

4. Rules to be Provided to Lessee. The Owner must provide the lessee with copies of the 
Declaration,   including   all   amendments,   and   all   rules,   regulations,   policies  
and procedures of the Association (the “Governing Documents”) as a condition of 

entering into the lease. The lease shall provide that the lessee and all occupants of the 
leased Lot are bound by and obligated to comply with the Governing Documents.

5. Registration.  An  Owner  who  wishes  to  lease  a  Lot  must  provide  a  completed 
registration document (the “Lease Notice Form”) to the Association at least ten (10) days 
before the commencement of any occupancy period. Any renewal agreement must also 
be provided to the Association.

6. Owner Responsible; Association Not Liable for Damages. The Owner of a leased Lot is 
liable to the Association for any expenses incurred by the Association in connection with 
enforcement of the Governing Documents against the Owner’s lessee. The Association is 
not liable to the Owner for any damages, including lost rents, suffered by the Owner in 
relation  to  the  Association’s  enforcement  of  the  Association’s  Governing  Documents 
against the Owner’s lessee.

Perhaps Cagle Pugh can draft the payment plan and act on collection enforcement should the
owners fail to make timely payments. Should Mrs. Olivetti be able to present a divorce decree
that shows Mr. Olivetti is responsible for arrears - that helps her in court should he not pay.

attorney and her divorce attorney to help enforce.
 
My opinion – this is not the HOA’s problem. Mr. Olivetti needs to pay the back balance in full
and we are done. He can carry a loan or credit card balance to pay off the balance due to the

La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

● The LaVentana swimming pools are SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pools.

● The swimming pools are for the use of the ROA Members and their invited guests only.

● Pool hours are from 6 am - 10 pm. Maximum guests per household is 12.

● Pools may not be used along with a clubhouse reservation or rental. Pools remain open to residents
at all times

documents.content:
La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

The following rules shall govern rentals of the Clubhouse for private events.

Reserved Space: A La Ventana Ranch Owners Association Member ROA Member (“ROA Member”), may
reserve the Clubhouse for a private event. In the context of rentals, the “Clubhouse” is the space that includes
the sitting room with fireplace, main room with TV and pool table, kitchen, restrooms and pavilion. It does not
include the pool, spas, exercise rooms, playground, tennis courts, golf range, and creek areas. These areas are
not available for reserving and shall remain available to all La Ventana Residents during any private event at
the Clubhouse.

Pool Usage: Pool usage during an event in which the clubhouse has been reserved / rented is NOT
allowed. ROA Members are responsible for their invited guests and that they follow rules. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries for members and or their guests while using
The clubhouse, pools and surrounding areas. The ROA Members using the pools are responsible for any
damages that may occur while they or their invited guests are using the pool.

Access. Only a ROA Member may rent the clubhouse.
(a) The ROA Member must be in good standing at the time the reservation is made and at the date and time in
which the event takes place. Should the ROA Member not be in good standing, the Homeowners Association
reserves the right to not allow the event to take place. .
(b) The ROA Member shall access the clubhouse with their assigned key card. The ROA member must be
present at all times during any use of the clubhouse and shall be personally responsible for the behavior of their
guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, deposit shall be forfeited.
(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.

documents.content:
Maximum guests per household is 12.

● Pools may not be used along with a clubhouse reservation or rental. Pools remain open to residents
at all times

● Leave gates closed. DO NOT prop them open.

● Noise must be kept to a minimum and any music turned off by 9:00 pm.

● Pool furniture cannot be removed from the pool area.

● NO DIVING allowed anywhere in the pool area. No jumping off ledge between the pools.

● The pools are shallow and diving and jumping off sides can cause injury.

● Running in the pool area is prohibited.

● No person under the age of 15 will be allowed at any time unless accompanied and supervised by an
adult.

● Non-swimmers of any age must be accompanied in the water by a responsible person within arms
reach.

● It is recommended that non swimmers wear some type of flotation device while in the pool.

● Proper swim attire is required (no cut offs allowed ).

● Children who are not toilet trained must wear a proper swim diaper, being a vinyl or plastic diaper
cover. Pull Ups and Swim Diapers do not hold urine and or feces and are not allowed.

● No glass containers of any type are allowed in the pool area.

● Pets and any type of motorized vehicles are not allowed in the pool area.

● Pool area is monitored with security cameras.

● No firearms or weapons of any type are allowed in the pool area.

● Members are responsible for replacing furniture when they move it.

● Members are responsible for cleaning up after themselves when using the pool area. There is no paid
Service company that comes to clean the pool area.

● Members are responsible for removing any items that they brought to the pool area.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 4

facilities on any dates and at any time it deems inappropriate or inconvenient to residents of La Ventana.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 3



La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

● The LaVentana swimming pools are SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pools.

● The swimming pools are for the use of the ROA Members and their invited guests only.

● Pool hours are from 6 am - 10 pm. Maximum guests per household is 12.

● Pools may not be used along with a clubhouse reservation or rental. Pools remain open to residents
at all times

● Leave gates closed. DO NOT prop them open.

● Noise must be kept to a minimum and any music turned off by 9:00 pm.

● Pool furniture cannot be removed from the pool area.

● NO DIVING allowed anywhere in the pool area. No jumping off ledge between the pools.

documents.content:
at the time in which the rental reservation is made. Security deposits are due one week
prior to the event. Once the reservation is made and payment is made your event is guaranteed. Failure to pay
the fees prior to the event, will be deemed to voluntary cancellation of the reservation. Payments for the rental
fees must be made online through Town Square.
(e) Refund of Security Deposit. The security deposit will be refunded if the Clubhouse and its contents are not
damaged and are in accordance with these conditions and to the satisfaction of the clubhouse committee
member. Damage to the Clubhouse or its contents, or failure to comply with these conditions will result in
forfeiture of the security deposit. The ROA Member will be responsible and liable for any damage that exceeds
the amount of the security deposit.

Supplies: The ROA Member is responsible for bringing their own supplies for their event. Replacement trash
bags for outdoor cans and indoor cans can be found in the pantry. Should you use any of the supplies in the
kitchen they are to be cleaned and put back where found.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 2



Clean Up: The ROA Member is fully responsible for removal of all trash and garbage from the inside of the
clubhouse, pavilion area and any other areas that may have been used during the event. Cleanup is to be done
the same day of the event. Failure to do so will result in forfeit of Security Deposit. All equipment, flowers,
caterer related items must be removed the same day of the event unless prearranged with the Clubhouse
Committee Member. Failure to do so may result in forfeit of security deposit.

Holidays: The clubhouse may not be reserved or rented on the following Holidays: Valentines Day, Easter,
Memorial Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, or New Years Eve. The intent of this clause is to
permit usage for LaVentana Community Events, on these particular Holidays.

documents.content:
La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

The following rules shall govern rentals of the Clubhouse for private events.

Reserved Space: A La Ventana Ranch Owners Association Member ROA Member (“ROA Member”), may
reserve the Clubhouse for a private event. In the context of rentals, the “Clubhouse” is the space that includes
the sitting room with fireplace, main room with TV and pool table, kitchen, and pavilion. It does not include
the pool, spas, exercise rooms, restrooms, playground, tennis courts, golf range, and creek areas. These areas
are not available for reserving and shall remain available to all La Ventana Residents during any private event
at the Clubhouse.

Pool Usage: Pool usage during an event in which the clubhouse has been reserved / rented is NOT
allowed. ROA Members are responsible to ensure their invited guests abide by all rules. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries to members and or their guests while using
the clubhouse, pools and surrounding areas. The ROA Members using the pools are responsible for any
damages that may occur while they or their invited guests are using the pool.

Access. Only a ROA Member may rent the clubhouse.
(a) The ROA Member must be in good standing at the time the reservation is made and at the date and time in
which the event takes place. Should the ROA Member not be in good standing, the Homeowners Association
reserves the right to cancel the event.
(b) The ROA Member shall access the clubhouse with their assigned key card. The ROA member must be
present at all times during any use of the clubhouse and shall be personally responsible for the behavior of their
guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, the deposit shall be forfeited.
(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.

documents.content:
kept to a minimum and any music turned off by 9:00 pm.

● Pool furniture cannot be removed from the pool area.

● NO DIVING allowed anywhere in the pool area. No jumping off ledge between the pools.

● The pools are shallow and diving and jumping off sides can cause injury.

● Running in the pool area is prohibited.

● No person under the age of 15 will be allowed at any time unless accompanied and supervised by an
adult.

● Non-swimmers of any age must be accompanied in the water by a responsible person within arms
reach.

● It is recommended that non swimmers wear some type of flotation device while in the pool.

● Proper swim attire is required (no cut offs allowed ).

● Children who are not toilet trained must wear a proper swim diaper, as well as a vinyl or plastic
diaper cover. Pull Ups and Swim Diapers do not hold urine and or feces and are not allowed.

● No glass containers of any type are allowed in the pool area.

● Pets and any type of motorized vehicles are not allowed in the pool area.

● Pool area is monitored with security cameras.

● No firearms or weapons of any type are allowed in the pool area.

● Members are responsible for replacing furniture when they move it.

● Members are responsible for cleaning up after themselves when using the pool area. There is no paid
Service company that comes to clean the pool area.

● Members are responsible for removing any items that they brought to the pool area.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 4

documents.content:
guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, the deposit shall be forfeited.
(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.
(d) The clubhouse is for Association Members and their guests to enjoy. As such, the clubhouse may not be
rented two consecutive nights after 4:00 pm by the same resident.

Guests: A “Guest” is any person attending a private event. Another La Ventana resident attending the event is
considered a “Guest” of the event and included in the guest count. The maximum number of Guests is 50
people. The ROA Member is responsible for the strict adherence to these limitations. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries of members and or their guests while using
the clubhouse and surrounding property.

Reservations: Please email lvclubhouserental@gmail.com to make arrangements for renting the Clubhouse.
Requests can also be made online through Town Square. A walk through with a Clubhouse Committee Member
will be required. Rental payments are to be made online through Town Square before the event can take place.
Should the event be canceled the full rental payment will be returned. The deposit in the form of a check
payable to LaVentana ROA will be held by the Clubhouse Committee Member and returned to the resident
once the event is over and an inspection of the clubhouse has been performed.

Hours: Clubhouse hours are 5:30am to 10:30 pm. All persons must vacate the Clubhouse at 10:30 pm.
Entering and or remaining at the clubhouse after 10:30 pm may result in loss of privileges.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 1



Thermostat: During the COOLER months, return the HEAT to 62 degrees. During theWARMER months,
return the AC to 78 degrees.

Parking: ROA Members and their Guests should park at the clubhouse parking lot. Parking on the street and or
grassy areas is prohibited.

Pets: No pets are permitted indoors.

I 

(f) No oil drilling, oil development operation, oil refining, quarrying or 
mining operations of any kind shall be permitted on the surface of the Property. No oil 
wells, tanks, tunnels, mineral excavations or shafts shall be permitted upon or in any part 
of the Property. No derrick or other structure designed for use in quarrying or boring for 
oil, natural gas or other minerals shall be erected, maintained or permitted on the 
Property. 

(g) No animals, livestock, fowl or poultry of any kind shall be raised, bred or 
kept on the Property, except that dogs, cats or other household pets may be kept for the 
purpose of providing companionship for the private family. Animals are notto be raised, 
bred or kept for commercial purposes or for food. It is the purpose of these provisions to 
restrict the use of the Property so that no person shall quarter on any part of the Property 
cows, horses, bees, pigeons, hogs, sheep, goats, guinea fowls, ducks, chickens, turkeys, 
skunks or any other animals that may interfere with the quietude, health or safety of the 
community. No more than three pets will be permitted on each Lot. Pets must be 
restrained or confined to the rear of the Owner's Lot inside a fenced area or Vlithin the 
house. It is the pet owner's responsibility to keep the Lot clean and free of pet debris. All 
animals must be properly tagged for identification and vaccinated against rabies. 

(h) No Lot or other area on the Property shall be used as a dumping ground 
for rubbish or a site for the accumulation of unsightly materials of any kind, including, 
but not limited to, broken or rusty equipment, disassembled or inoperative cars and 
discarded appliances and furniture. Trash, garbage or other waste shall not be kept 
except in sanitary containers. All equipment for the storage or other disposal of such 
material shall be kept in clean and sanitary condition. All containers and other facilities

documents.content:
including horses, subject to Section 3.54, longhorn cattle, llamas and other livestock and wildlife that Declarant or the Association determines to own and raise and/or manage on the Common Area. No animal shall be allowed to make an unreasonable amount of noise or to become a nuisance, through noise or otherwise, and no domestic pets will, e allowed on the Property other than on the Lot of its Owner unless confined to a leash. No animal shall be allowed to run at large, and all animals shall be kept within enclosed areas which must be clean, sanitary and reasonably free of refuse, insects and waste at all times. Such an enclosed area shall be constructed in accordance with plans approved by the Architectural Committee, shall be reasonably designed and constructed to adequately contain such animals in accordance with the provisions hereof, and shall be screened so as not to be visible from any other portion of the Property. In no event shall Pit bulls or other vicious or danger us animals be allowed on the Property. The Front Fields are the "leash free" zone for pets belonging Owners so long as the pet Owner is present to supervise their pet(s) and the pet(s) are trained and obedient. Equestrian Lots are allowed the full-time boarding of no more than two (2) horses each.

Please discontinue breeding or boarding animals at your residence. We respectfully ask for your timely cooperation, please cure by: 12/30/2024.

We are sure that you want to correct this situation and abide by the Covenants, Conditions, and Restrictions of the neighborhood. However, if you continue non-compliance the Association will be left with no alternative but to institute steps to achieve your cooperation.

Thank you in advance for your help in preserving the integrity of La Ventana Ranch Owners Association, Inc. If you have any questions concerning this notice, please contact our Customer Inspection department via email at info@psprop.net.







Sincerely,

June 20, 2024

Jakob Skelton & Stephanie Chang
914 Ranchers Club Ln
Driftwood TX 78619

Re: La Ventana Ranch Owners Association, Inc.
Property: 914 Ranchers Club Ln
Violation: Animals & Pets - Boarding or Breeding
Location: On Property

Dear Jakob Skelton & Stephanie Chang

As the managing agent for La Ventana Ranch Owners Association, Inc., Goodwin & Company is
responsible for the administration of the Association's governing documents and rules and regulations. 
The Association is committed to maintaining your neighborhood in a manner that is both aesthetically
pleasing and protective of property values.

The purpose of this letter is to bring to your attention that it has been observed or reported that a situation
of non-compliance needs your attention:

    Please discontinue breeding or boarding animals at your residence. You are only allowed up to six
ducks.

Please note that continued non-compliance will result in the next fine being assessed at $50.00.  

We are sure that you would want to know about the above situation, and we request your assistance in
correcting the above issue. To assist us in our efforts to preserve the overall appearance of the community,
we respectfully ask your timely cooperation.

Thank you in advance for your help in preserving the integrity of La Ventana Ranch Owners Association,
Inc..  If you have any questions concerning this notice please contact the inspector by email at
Compliance@goodwintx.com or phone at (512) 502-2115.

Sincerely,
Goodwin & Company
Agent for La Ventana Ranch Owners Association, Inc.

Warning - 2nd Notice

Dear Jakob Skelton & Stephanie Chang:

As the managing agent for La Ventana Ranch Owners Association, Inc., PS Property Management, Inc. is responsible for the administration of the Association's governing documents and rules and regulations. The Association is committed to maintaining your neighborhood in a manner that is both aesthetically pleasing and protective of property values.

The purpose of this letter is to bring to your attention that on 12/10/2024 1:32:47 PM once again it has been observed and/or reported that a previous instance of non-compliance has not been cured or has re-occurred. The following needs your immediate attention: You are not allowed to have any ducks on your property. Also, you are to remove all the related duck coups, tarps, etc. There is a $50 fine for this second violation. It will be assigned to your account through PS Property Management. Please reference the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions, and Restriction, Section 3.28 regarding this violation for further information.

3.28 Animals-Household Pets. No animals, including pigs, poultry, fowl, wild animals, cattle, sheep, goats or any other type of animal not considered to be a domestic household pet within the ordinary meaning and interpretation of such words may be kept, maintained or cared for on the Property, except for the animals, including horses, subject to Section 3.54, longhorn cattle, llamas and other livestock and wildlife that Declarant or the Association determines to own and raise and/or manage on the Common Area.

•

The following restrictions apply to signs advertising a political candidate or ballot item for an 
election, as described in Chapter 202: 

a. The signs may be displayed only during the period beginning 90 days before the date of the election to 
which the sign relates and ending 10 days after that election date. 

b. Only one sign for each candidate or ballot item may be displayed at each residence, and no sign may 
be larger than four feet by six feet. 

c. Each sign must be ground-mounted, and no sign may (i) contains roofing material, siding, paving 
materials, flora, one or more balloons or lights, or any other similar building, landscaping, or nonstandard 
decorative component, (ii) be attached in any way to plant material, a traffic control device, a light, a 
trailer, a vehicle, or any other existing structure or object, (iii) include the painting of architectural 
surfaces, (iv) threaten the public health or safety, (v) violate a law, (vi) contain language, graphics, or 
any display that would be offensive to the ordinary person, or (vii) be accompanied by music or other 
sounds, by streamers, or otherwise be distracting to motorists. 

d. The Association may remove a sign displayed in violation of these standards. 

12. Lights: states, " ... No holiday or occasion lighting or decorations shall be installed earlier than 
thirty (30) days prior to occasion and must be removed no later than twenty (20) days after the event. 

13. Disposal of Trash: states, "All rubbish, trash, garbage or other waste shall be kept in sanitary 
containers and out of sight of the Common Area and any street or adjacent Lot, except on days designated 
. .. for pick-up of such garbage." 

14. Animals and Livestock: states, "No more than three (3) pets shall be kept on a Lot. All pets must be 
properly tagged for identification ... No pet may be chained or leashed outside an enclosure unless being 
walked on a leash.

tables and chairs must be wiped clean.
(c) The kitchen must be properly cleaned and returned to its original condition. Any food brought in must be
removed from the refrigerator and or freezer.
(d) Trash cans indoors and outdoors are to be emptied and trash placed in the trash bins located in parking lot.
(e) Restrooms trash cans emptied and countertops wiped down.
(f) All furniture must be returned to its original position.
(g) All greenery, flowers, decorations and other items brought in must be removed.
(h) Pavilion, if used, should be swept, all trash cans emptied and furniture put back to its original place.
(i) All lights, appliances and fans must be turned off.
Failure to strictly comply with the cleaning requirements will result in forfeit of security deposit.

Damages: The ROA Member will be held responsible for any damage caused by the member and or their
guests. The breach or violation of any condition set forth herein may result in the loss of the security deposit,
the imposition of liability on the ROA Member, and possible denial of future rentals of the Clubhouse.

Right of Refusal: The Association reserves the right to refuse to rent the facilities for any purpose it deems to
be detrimental to or not in the best interests of its members. It further reserves the right to refuse to rent the
facilities on any dates and at any time it deems inappropriate or inconvenient to residents of La Ventana.

La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

● The LaVentana swimming pools are SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pools.

● The swimming pools are for the use of the ROA Members and their invited guests only.

● Pool hours are from 6 am - 10 pm. Maximum guests per household is 12.

● Pools may not be used along with a clubhouse reservation or rental. Pools remain open to residents
at all times

● Leave gates closed. DO NOT prop them open.

guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, deposit shall be forfeited.
(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.
(d) The clubhouse is for Association Members and their guests to enjoy, the clubhouse may not be rented two
consecutive nights after 4:00 pm by the same resident.

Guests: A “Guest” is any person invited and that attends an event. Another La Ventana resident attending the
event is considered a “Guest” of the event and included in the guest count. The maximum number of Guests
is 50 people. The ROA Member is responsible for the strict adherence to these limitations. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries of members and or their guests while using
the clubhouse and surrounding property.

Reservations: Please email lvclubhouserental@gmail.com to make arrangements for renting the Clubhouse.
Requests can also be made online through Town Square. A walk through with a Clubhouse Committee
Member will be required. Rental payments are to be made online through Town Square before the event can
take place. Should the event be canceled the full rental payment will be returned. The deposit in the form of a
check payable to LaVentana ROA will be held by the Clubhouse Committee Member and returned to the
resident once the event is over and all is satisfactory with the clubhouse.

Hours: Clubhouse hours are 5:30am to 10:30 pm. All persons must vacate the Clubhouse at 10:30 pm.
Entering and or remaining at the clubhouse after 10:30 pm may result in loss of privileges.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 1



Thermostat: During the COOLER months, return the HEAT to 62 degrees. During theWARMER months,
return the AC to 78 degrees.

Parking: ROA Members and their Guests should park at the clubhouse parking lot. Parking on the street and or
grassy areas is prohibited.

Pets: No pets are permitted indoors.

documents.content:
La Ventana Ranch Owners Association
Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules

October 1, 2023

The following rules shall govern rentals of the Clubhouse for private events.

Reserved Space: A La Ventana Ranch Owners Association Member ROA Member (“ROA Member”), may
reserve the Clubhouse for a private event. In the context of rentals, the “Clubhouse” is the space that includes
the sitting room with fireplace, main room with TV and pool table, kitchen, restrooms and pavilion. It does not
include the pool, spas, exercise rooms, playground, tennis courts, golf range, and creek areas. These areas are
not available for reserving and shall remain available to all La Ventana Residents during any private event at
the Clubhouse.

Pool Usage: Pool usage during an event in which the clubhouse has been reserved / rented is NOT
allowed. ROA Members are responsible for their invited guests and that they follow rules. The LaVentana
Homeowners Association will not be responsible for any injuries for members and or their guests while using
The clubhouse, pools and surrounding areas. The ROA Members using the pools are responsible for any
damages that may occur while they or their invited guests are using the pool.

Access. Only a ROA Member may rent the clubhouse.
(a) The ROA Member must be in good standing at the time the reservation is made and at the date and time in
which the event takes place. Should the ROA Member not be in good standing, the Homeowners Association
reserves the right to not allow the event to take place. .
(b) The ROA Member shall access the clubhouse with their assigned key card. The ROA member must be
present at all times during any use of the clubhouse and shall be personally responsible for the behavior of their
guests. If an ROA Member is not present at all times during their event, deposit shall be forfeited.
(c) All persons under the age of 15 must be supervised by an adult while at the clubhouse.

at the time in which the rental reservation is made. Security deposits are due one week
prior to the event. Once the reservation is made and payment is made your event is guaranteed. Failure to pay
the fees prior to the event, will be deemed to voluntary cancellation of the reservation. Payments for the rental
fees must be made online through Town Square.
(e) Refund of Security Deposit. The security deposit will be refunded if the Clubhouse and its contents are not
damaged and are in accordance with these conditions and to the satisfaction of the clubhouse committee
member. Damage to the Clubhouse or its contents, or failure to comply with these conditions will result in
forfeiture of the security deposit. The ROA Member will be responsible and liable for any damage that exceeds
the amount of the security deposit.

Supplies: The ROA Member is responsible for bringing their own supplies for their event. Replacement trash
bags for outdoor cans and indoor cans can be found in the pantry. Should you use any of the supplies in the
kitchen they are to be cleaned and put back where found.

La Ventana Clubhouse Rental Rules, Regulations and Pool Rules 2



Clean Up: The ROA Member is fully responsible for removal of all trash and garbage from the inside of the
clubhouse, pavilion area and any other areas that may have been used during the event. Cleanup is to be done
the same day of the event. Failure to do so will result in forfeit of Security Deposit. All equipment, flowers,
caterer related items must be removed the same day of the event unless prearranged with the Clubhouse
Committee Member. Failure to do so may result in forfeit of security deposit.

Holidays: The clubhouse may not be reserved or rented on the following Holidays: Valentines Day, Easter,
Memorial Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, or New Years Eve. The intent of this clause is to
permit usage for LaVentana Community Events, on these particular Holidays.

RENTAL AND LEASING RULES 

Rental and Leasing Rules 

The  following  rules  are  adopted  by  the  La Ventan Ranch Owners  Association,  Inc.  (the  
“Association”) and shall apply to every owner (“Owner”) of a lot (“Lot”) in La Ventana ROA.  

Leasing Requirements. The rental or lease of any Lot must comply with the following rules: 

1. Minimum Lease Term. Any lease must be for an initial term of not less than ninety (90) 
days. The foregoing  leasing restriction shall not apply to an Owner who, following the 
sale of a Lot, leases the Lot back from the purchaser.

2. Entire Lot Leased. A Lot may be  leased only  in  its entirety; no fraction or portion of a 
Lot may be leased.

3. Lease to be in Writing. The lease must be in writing.

4. Rules to be Provided to Lessee. The Owner must provide the lessee with copies of the 
Declaration,   including   all   amendments,   and   all   rules,   regulations,   policies  
and procedures of the Association (the “Governing Documents”) as a condition of 

entering into the lease. The lease shall provide that the lessee and all occupants of the 
leased Lot are bound by and obligated to comply with the Governing Documents.

5. Registration.  An  Owner  who  wishes  to  lease  a  Lot  must  provide  a  completed 
registration document (the “Lease Notice Form”) to the Association at least ten (10) days 
before the commencement of any occupancy period. Any renewal agreement must also 
be provided to the Association.

6. Owner Responsible; Association Not Liable for Damages. The Owner of a leased Lot is 
liable to the Association for any expenses incurred by the Association in connection with 
enforcement of the Governing Documents against the Owner’s lessee. The Association is 
not liable to the Owner for any damages, including lost rents, suffered by the Owner in 
relation  to  the  Association’s  enforcement  of  the  Association’s  Governing  Documents 
against the Owner’s lessee.

documents.content:
LA VENTANA’S ARCHITECTURAL COMMITTEE 
The Architectural Committee (AC) is a necessary fixture of neighborhood life. In La Ventana, the AC is made of volunteers who are appointed by the Board. They knowingly take on the role of reviewing, approving, and sometimes denying projects that affect the look and feel of our community, or which otherwise do not comply with the rules we all agreed to live by.  The work they do is central to keeping La Ventana beautiful, cohesive, and consistent with the standards outlined in our CCRs and Bylaws.
The AC’s responsibility extends beyond new home construction. They also review applications for a wide range of projects: roofs, pools, patios, garages, casitas, driveways, sheds, rainwater tanks, and fencing, to name a few. They keep an eye on smaller improvements too, such as outdoor lighting, flagpoles, playscapes, treehouses, porches, decks, mailboxes, landscaping, walkways, screening walls, satellite dishes, generators, and solar panels.  If you are unsure whether your project requires an application, please consult with any member of the AC. It is better to contact them than to begin a project without approval! 
The application process is straightforward. Forms are available on the PS Management website under Documents → Forms. Once you submit your application, the management company posts it, and then a member of the AC will contact you to arrange a site visit. That visit to help clarify your plans and ensure they align with the community’s standards. After the review, you’ll receive an email either granting approval or asking for adjustments. If your project changes partway through construction, it’s important to resubmit those changes for re-evaluation.
While the CCRs and Bylaws give the committee the authority to enforce compliance, your AC doesn’t see itself as the neighborhood police.

LA VENTANA’S ARCHITECTURAL COMMITTEE 
The Architectural Committee (AC) is a necessary fixture of neighborhood life. In La Ventana, the AC is made of volunteers who are appointed by the Board. They knowingly take on the role of reviewing, approving, and sometimes denying projects that affect the look and feel of our community, or which otherwise do not comply with the rules we all agreed to live by.  The work they do is central to keeping La Ventana beautiful, cohesive, and consistent with the standards outlined in our CCRs and Bylaws.
The AC’s responsibility extends beyond new home construction. They also review applications for a wide range of projects: roofs, pools, patios, garages, casitas, driveways, sheds, rainwater tanks, and fencing, to name a few. They keep an eye on smaller improvements too, such as outdoor lighting, flagpoles, playscapes, treehouses, porches, decks, mailboxes, landscaping, walkways, screening walls, satellite dishes, generators, and solar panels.  If you are unsure whether your project requires an application, please consult with any member of the AC. It is better to contact them than to begin a project without approval! 
The application process is straightforward. Forms are available on the PS Management website under Documents → Forms. Once you submit your application, the management company posts it, and then a member of the AC will contact you to arrange a site visit. That visit to help clarify your plans and ensure they align with the community’s standards. After the review, you’ll receive an email either granting approval or asking for adjustments. If your project changes partway through construction, it’s important to resubmit those changes for re-evaluation.
While the CCRs and Bylaws give the committee the authority to enforce compliance, your AC doesn’t see itself as the neighborhood police.

documents.content:
it’s important to resubmit those changes for re-evaluation.
While the CCRs and Bylaws give the committee the authority to enforce compliance, your AC doesn’t see itself as the neighborhood police. We are here to help and guide you with not only understanding the CCRs, but the functionality of your project, and perhaps provide historical information.  The members view their role as striking a balance between protecting individual homeowners’ visions and ensuring that those visions don’t undermine the look or value of the community as a whole. The AC exists to prevent those conflicts and maintain fairness. 
At the end of the day, the AC is one of those features of an HOA that may feel burdensome until you step back and see the bigger picture. By following the process, you not only stay in compliance with the CCRs, but you also contribute to keeping La Ventana the unique, harmonious, and beautiful place we all call home.

midnight to 10am, and: 

• prohibits outdoor use for washing of Flatwork & Structures;

• Water leaks to be repaired asap & prohibition for any general waste of water. 

• Stage 4 

• Irrigation strictly prohibited, with exception for stressed Shade Trees (per

documents.content:
strict drought restrictions than HTGCD has. This is because some areas (e.g., Dripping Springs 
and West Austin) get some of their water from Lake Travis via the Lower Colorado River 
Authority.  

Can LVROA Punish or Fine Water Overuse Within La Ventana? 

LVROA generally does not have the authority to penalize water overuse. This is a matter 
between SWL and the individual customers. An exception is in the Deed Covenants, Conditions, 
and Restrictions for the Preserve/Phase 3 which have some restrictions on outside water.  
Violations there can be subject to the LVROA fine structure. Even the HTGCD does not have the 
authority to restrict or regulate “exempt wells” (wells which produce no more than 25,000 
gallons per day). This is a matter of state law because current state statutes do not grant 
HTGCD the authority to permit and regulate an exempt well. The state legislature would have 
to address disparity.  

What is a Reasonable Amount of Water Consumption for a Household?  



Our current average is about 350 gallons/day/connection (10,646 gal/mo.).  However, we have 
been operating under an emergency stage 4 curtailment at a 40% reduction of this baseline 
since August 2022—reducing it to 210 gal/day or 6,400 gal/mo. The water budget from HTGCD 
is based on state and national averages and recommendations.  These guidelines are declining 
over time to reflect the new normal for drought, as well as recognition for the modern water 
saving water fixtures we love so much. The latest projections suggest a per-capita consumption 
of about 70 gal/day, that is 150 – 200 gal/day for a 2–3-person household. Historically, La 
Ventana has used slightly more than our neighbors—366 gal/day vs. 226 gal/day for the 
average of the other top 15 water companies.  However, since 2022, when we have been under 
drought restrictions, our average has decreased into the low 300’s – in line with the reduced 
allocations.

documents.content:
will be necessary on a more urgent basis to address unclear language 
within the CCR’s which may inadvertently allow Airbnb and Vrbo vacation home rentals to exist within the La Ventana 
community. In our board’s discussion with residents, almost without exception (the exceptions being those renting 
out their homes for a weekend), these “Airbnb rentals” over the weekend are strongly objected to.

 Our community has long been valued for its quiet, peaceful atmosphere, which is why many of us chose to live here. 
However, with the rise of short-term rental platforms like Vrbo and Airbnb, there’s been an influx of weekend 
vacationers and partygoers that can disrupt the tranquility we cherish. While these services weren’t around when our 
CCRs were originally drafted, we now face the need to clarify rental guidelines to preserve the integrity of our 
neighborhood. Currently, Section 3.41 of the CCRs allows for home rentals but does not define what constitutes 
"short-term." To address this, we propose amending the CCRs to define "short-term rental" as a minimum of six 
months to a year, and "long-term rental" as anything over a year. This change would ensure that homeowners can 
still rent their properties, but it would effectively prohibit transient vacationers from using homes as weekend 
getaways, which include partying outside in a pool, loud barbecues until late in the night, driving fast on our roads, 
and a general disruption of the community's quiet environment. La Ventana is not a resort for weekend warriors—it’s 
home.  

By adding this simple clarification, we can maintain the peaceful atmosphere that attracted all of us to this 
neighborhood in the first place, while still allowing responsible, long-term rentals. Your support in amending the 
CCRs is crucial to keeping our community the peaceful, residential haven we all enjoy. Your participation in this

1. The Chandler Creek HOA swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pool.  No lifeguards are on duty.  Children 
under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule is 
strictly enforced. 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion. Please use caution. 

3. All Chandler Creek HOA residents are required to show their pool access pass device and a valid State of Texas ID if 
requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 

4. The access gates can only be opened with your assigned pool access device.  Gates are to remain closed/locked at all 
times.  The Pool Monitors have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access device.  Anyone 
without a pool access device will be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under 
no circumstances should the gate(s) be propped open.  There is a $20 replacement fee for lost/defective pool access 
devices. 

5. One household may host up to four (4) pool guests.  All pool guests must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek HOA 
resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to always enforce the current pool rules.  Conduct by any person 
deemed to be dangerous, unreasonable, or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to 
the Pool Monitor.  Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the 
rest of the season. 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger.  Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries 
which would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult 
supervisor;

CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES (revised 06-2022) 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm / Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS WHO HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS ARE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL 

AND TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not 
explicitly covered by these and other rules.  They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings 
should be taken to HOA management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitor(s).  Pool Monitors 
are authorized to enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these pool rules will be reported to the HOA Board, 
HOA management company and/or the Williamson County Sheriff's Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board's discretion. 

1. The Chandler Creek HOA swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OWN RISK pool.  No lifeguards are on duty.  Children

documents.content:
card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.
